original: yul shes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul shes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat consciousness which is the consciousness of the object‚Äù refers to the cognition that has the mode of apprehending the image of the object.

original: de ni yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa snang ba can yul gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don yin no //
analyzed: de ni yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa snang ba can yul gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the reason is that it is because the cognition that is in conformity with the object, which is the consciousness that has the image of the object, is the very object of the cognition.

original: rang snang ba zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam ba can gyi rnam par shes pa snang bar 'gyur ba ste bdag nyid snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang snang ba zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam ba can gyi rnam par shes pa snang bar 'gyur ba ste bdag nyid snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which appears to itself‚Äù means that the consciousness that has the image of the object appears, that is, is the object of its own appearance.

original: de ltar ma yin na gal te yul gyi ngo bo kho na 'ba' zhig yul gyi shes pa yin par 'gyur gyi ngo bo ma yin pa'am nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa nyid yin na yang yul gyi rnam pa nyid ma yin pa'i de'i shes pa yang ste
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na gal te yul gyi ngo bo kho na 'ba' zhig yul gyi shes pa yin par 'gyur gyi ngo bo ma yin pa'am nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa nyid yin na yang yul gyi rnam pa nyid ma yin pa'i de'i shes pa yang ste
translated: If it were not so, if the nature of the object alone were the object-cognition, and not the nature of the experience, then the cognition of that would not have the image of the object.

original: / yul shes pa yang yul shes pa'i shes pa dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / yul shes pa yang yul shes pa'i shes pa dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
translated: And the object-cognition would be no different from the cognition of the object-cognition.

original: khyad par med pa na yul nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa'i yul can gyis bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyad par med pa na yul nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa'i yul can gyis bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And if there is no difference, then the object-cognition would not be generated by the subject that has the aspect of the experience of the object.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar yul shes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa can nyid yin na yang de shes pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro // 'di ltar yul shes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa can nyid yin na yang de shes pa ste /
translated: Thus, the experience of blue, etc. would not be established.

original: yul gyi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can du rig pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can du rig pa yin no //
translated: In this way, although the object-cognition has the aspect of the object, it is known to have the nature of apprehending the cognition of the object.

original: de ni ma yin na shes pa'i shes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyis yul gyi shes pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid du de mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin na shes pa'i shes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyis yul gyi shes pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid du de mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, the cognition of cognition would not apprehend the object-cognition by means of the aspect of the object, and it would not have the nature of the experience of blue, etc.

original: 'dzin pa dang 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: It is both the apprehender and the transformation.

original: de ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa de'i phyir de la yang yul gyi rnam pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa de'i phyir de la yang yul gyi rnam pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Because it has the nature that has been explained, therefore it also has the aspect of an object.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
translated: That experience consciousness

original: shes de yis ni dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes de yis ni dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: is also the object of that consciousness.

original: nyams su myong ba'i yul can gyi shes pas so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i yul can gyi shes pas so //
translated: The consciousness that has the experience of the object.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig gis she na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig gis she na /
translated: What kind of consciousness?

original: cha gnyis dmigs pa can gyis so //
analyzed: cha gnyis dmigs pa can gyis so //
translated: The one that has two parts as its object.

original: di ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: di ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na //
translated: How does it become the object?

original: rnam pa gcig las khyad par can gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig las khyad par can gyis so //
translated: The one that has a special aspect.

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa gcig las khyad par du gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pa yin te des so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa gcig las khyad par du gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pa yin te des so //
translated: The aspect of the object is special in that it is one aspect of the experience.

original: de la 'dir nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te dpyod pa'i shes pa yang de'i shes pas ji ltar bsam pa'i don gyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi shes pa gzhan gyis dmigs par 'gyur
analyzed: de la 'dir nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te dpyod pa'i shes pa yang de'i shes pas ji ltar bsam pa'i don gyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi shes pa gzhan gyis dmigs par 'gyur
translated: Here, the consciousness of experience is merely an illustration, because the consciousness that analyzes it is also the consciousness that experiences the aspect of the object that is the nature of the consciousness that conceives of the object in a certain way.

original: ro // de ltar na ji ltar @232a * //
analyzed: ro // de ltar na ji ltar @232a * //
translated: Thus, how is it?üîΩ

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i don gyi ngo bo 'ba' zhig gam nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa 'dis 'dra ba'i don dang ldan par gyur to zhes cha gnyi ga shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i don gyi ngo bo 'ba' zhig gam nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa 'dis 'dra ba'i don dang ldan par gyur to zhes cha gnyi ga shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the cognition that experiences the object does not experience the object‚Äôs nature alone, nor does it experience the nature of the experience alone. Rather, it experiences both aspects, thinking, ‚ÄúThis cognition has an object that is similar to it.‚Äù

original: de ltar na nga'i bsam pa 'di 'dra bar gyur to zhes bsam pa yang rang gi shes pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi phyir 'di ltar yul gyi rnam pa can yul gyi shes pa de'i shes pas dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de'i yul gyi rnam pa can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nga'i bsam pa 'di 'dra bar gyur to zhes bsam pa yang rang gi shes pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro // gang gi phyir 'di ltar yul gyi rnam pa can yul gyi shes pa de'i shes pas dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de'i yul gyi rnam pa can yin no //
translated: In the same way, the cognition that experiences the thought ‚ÄúI have this kind of thought‚Äù experiences itself.üîΩThe cognition that has the aspect of an object is the cognition that observes that object. Therefore, it has the aspect of that object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam pa can la rang gi shes pas dmigs par 'gyur ba de ni de'i rnam ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam pa can la rang gi shes pas dmigs par 'gyur ba de ni de'i rnam ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever has the aspect of something is observed by a cognition that has its own aspect, as in the case of a cognition that has the aspect of blue.

original: dper na lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa can gyi ba lang gi shes pas dmigs pa na lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa can gyi ba lang gi shes pas dmigs pa na lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the consciousness of an ox has the aspect of possessing a dewlap, etc., it is observed as possessing a dewlap, etc.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang rang gi shes pas dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang rang gi shes pas dmigs pa yin no //
translated: And the consciousness that has the aspect of the object is observed by its own consciousness.

original: de'i rnam pa can la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam gzhag 'di ni don de'i rnam pa can gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam gzhag 'di ni don de'i rnam pa can gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the presentation of the object of the aspect of that consciousness because it is the cause of the aspect of that object.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid yin la /
translated: This is a syllogism of effect.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: At other times it is a syllogism of nature.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yang 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yang 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar gzhan du de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan du de ni /
translated: Because in other cases,

original: yul gyi shes pa de dngos min //
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa de dngos min //
translated: that is not the object of that consciousness.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can ma yin pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can ma yin pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be that which does not have the aspect of the object?

original: ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It could not!

original: de ltar na yul gyi rnam pa can gyis rang nyid 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na yul gyi rnam pa can gyis rang nyid 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, consciousness that has the aspect of the object and that has the mode of apprehending itself would exist.

original: gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would also be tenable.

original: de'i phyir de'i yul gyi rnam pa can no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i yul gyi rnam pa can no //
translated: Therefore, it would have the aspect of its object.

original: gal te yul gyi shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can du mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the consciousness of the object did not have the aspect of the object,

original: mi 'dod pa'i zhig tu 'gyur ba de'i tshe de mi 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i zhig tu 'gyur ba de'i tshe de mi 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then it would not be the object, and at that time it would not be tenable that it is the object.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says:

original: shes pa phyi ma phyi ma yul snga ma bskal pa snang ba can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma phyi ma yul snga ma bskal pa snang ba can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The later consciousness would not appear as the earlier object,

original: de'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: because it would not be its object.

original: phyi ma phyi ma de nyams su myong ba'i shes pa la de'i shes pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma de nyams su myong ba'i shes pa la de'i shes pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The later consciousness that experiences that would not arise as the later consciousness of that and so on.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩyul snga ma snga ma bskal par snang ba can te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / yul snga ma snga ma bskal par snang ba can te /
translated: How so?üîΩThe later consciousness would not appear as the earlier object.

original: shes pa bskal pa'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa bskal pa'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The consciousness would not be the object of a different consciousness.

original: snga ma la phyi ma phyi ma 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma la phyi ma phyi ma 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The latter would not retain the former.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i yul nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latter is not the object of the former.

original: don snga ma de ni shes pa phyi ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar yul snga @232b ma bskal par snang ba can du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: don snga ma de ni shes pa phyi ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar yul snga @232b ma bskal par snang ba can du 'gyur ba /
translated: The former object is not the object of the latter cognition.

original: de ltar phyi ma phyi ma yi //üîΩshes pa rnam gcig lhag ba can //
analyzed: de ltar phyi ma phyi ma yi // shes pa rnam gcig lhag ba can //
translated: In this way, the former object would be the object of a cognition that appears at a later time.üîΩIn this way, the latter cognitionüîΩhas only one aspect.

original: rnam pa re re 'di la lhag pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa re re 'di la lhag pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: rnam pa re re lhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa re re lhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that each aspect is only one.

original: 'dis ni shes pa phyi ma phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thal ba bzlog par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa phyi ma phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thal ba bzlog par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the consequence that the latter cognition would be without an object is avoided.

original: rnam pa re re lhag ma nyid kyang bum pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pas bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la dmigs ba na bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa re re lhag ma nyid kyang bum pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pas bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la dmigs ba na bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the cognition that experiences the vase observes the cognition that has the aspect of the vase, it understands that it is a cognition that has the aspect of the vase.

original: de'i phyir shes pa'i shes pas bum pa'i shes pa la dmigs pa bum pa'i shes pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bum pa'i rnam pa dang bcas par bum pa'i shes pa'i shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa'i shes pas bum pa'i shes pa la dmigs pa bum pa'i shes pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bum pa'i rnam pa dang bcas par bum pa'i shes pa'i shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of the consciousness of the pot is the consciousness of the consciousness of the pot that has the appearance of the pot, and thus the consciousness of the consciousness of the pot is cognized as having the aspect of the pot.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bstan to //
translated: In the same way, the pervasion of the reason should be shown in the other cases as well.

original: yul shes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes par snang ba dang rang snang ba yin no //
analyzed: yul shes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes par snang ba dang rang snang ba yin no //
translated: The consciousness that is the consciousness of the object is the appearance of the object, the appearance of the consciousness.

original: gal te de nyid gang las yin /
analyzed: gal te de nyid gang las yin /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is that itself?

original: gang gis ni de'i dbang gis nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yang gnyis su snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ni de'i dbang gis nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yang gnyis su snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what is the consciousness that experiences it made to appear as two?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir shes pa gnyis pa de ni don gyi ngo bor snang ba dang yul gyi shes pa dang 'brel pa can dag ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa gnyis pa de ni don gyi ngo bor snang ba dang yul gyi shes pa dang 'brel pa can dag ste /
translated: Because that second consciousness appears as the entity of the object and is related to the consciousness of the object,

original: de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa yul du snang pa dang rang snang ba'i mtshan nyid can dag ni /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas 'ongs pa yul du snang pa dang rang snang ba'i mtshan nyid can dag ni /
translated: it is said to come from that, and it has the characteristic of appearing as the object and appearing as the consciousness.

original: yul nyid du snang ba dag go //
analyzed: yul nyid du snang ba dag go //
translated: The object itself appears.

original: 'ga' zhig bdag gi rnam pa la //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bdag gi rnam pa la //
translated: Some say: The cognition of the object

original: rang nyid snang ba'i mtshan nyid can //üîΩgsum pa'i shes pa'i shes pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba can gyi shes pas rnam par 'byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang nyid snang ba'i mtshan nyid can // gsum pa'i shes pa'i shes pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba can gyi shes pas rnam par 'byed par 'gyur /
translated: has the aspect of the self and is characterized by self-appearance.

original: yang dag par dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition of the cognition of the third, which arises immediately after the cognition of the object, distinguishes it and correctly apprehends it.

original: de'i phyir rang snang ba nyid kyang de'i shes pa yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang snang ba nyid kyang de'i shes pa yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that self-appearance is also its cognition.

original: gal te yul gyi rnam pa can nyams su myong ba'i shes par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de'i tshe shes pa'i shes pa yang ste /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi rnam pa can nyams su myong ba'i shes par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de'i tshe shes pa'i shes pa yang ste /
translated: If it is said that the cognition of the object is experienced as having the aspect of the object, then the cognition of the cognition would also be the cognition of the object,

original: yul gyi shes pa'i shes pa khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa'i shes pa khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and there would be no difference between the cognition of the object and the cognition of the cognition.

original: de'i phyir 'di la yul gyi rnam pas byas pa'i rjes su bsgyur ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la yul gyi rnam pas byas pa'i rjes su bsgyur ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, there is a transformation brought about by the aspect of the object.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te gal te 'di ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yul gyi rnam pas nye bar sgyur bar bar byas pa ni shes pa'i shes pa khyad par 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te gal te 'di ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yul gyi rnam pas nye bar sgyur bar bar byas pa ni shes pa'i shes pa khyad par 'di ma yin no //
translated: That is not so. If the consciousness that experiences is transformed by the aspect of the object, then the consciousness of consciousness is not this special feature.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: don las yin te /
analyzed: don las yin te /
translated: It is from the object.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par med pa nyid du skye ba de ni don gyi 'bras bu @233a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par med pa nyid du skye ba de ni don gyi 'bras bu @233a * //
translated: The arising of consciousness without an aspect is the result of the object.

original: yin te / don las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / don las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the result of the object because it arises from the object.

original: don gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pas na 'bras bur gyur pa yul gyi shes pa la dran pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pas na 'bras bur gyur pa yul gyi shes pa la dran pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is the result of the object, memory arises in the consciousness of the object that is its result.üîΩFor example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThis is the consciousness that is the result of the object.‚Äù

original: dper na don gyi 'bras bu'i shes pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba lta bu gang yin pa de 'di na pa de ni don gyi 'bras bu nyid du skyes par gyur ba na /
analyzed: dper na don gyi 'bras bu'i shes pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba lta bu gang yin pa de 'di na pa de ni don gyi 'bras bu nyid du skyes par gyur ba na /
translated: When that arises as the result of the object,

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i don yang dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i don yang dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: the object that is its cause is also remembered.

original: gal te don dran pa yod na phyis 'khrul pas nyams su myong ba'i shes pa rnam pa med pa yin na skyes bus don des rnam pa dang ldan par srid pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dran pa yod na phyis 'khrul pas nyams su myong ba'i shes pa rnam pa med pa yin na skyes bus don des rnam pa dang ldan par srid pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the object is remembered, then later on, the consciousness that experiences the object through error would have no aspect. But it is possible for a person to have an aspect through that object.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: de la / shes dran don gyi 'bras bu nyid phyir //
analyzed: de la / shes dran don gyi 'bras bu nyid phyir //
translated: Because memory of the object is the result,

original: gal te don ni dran pa las //
analyzed: gal te don ni dran pa las //
translated: if the object is remembered,

original: 'khrul pas sred par byed yin na //
analyzed: 'khrul pas sred par byed yin na //
translated: then it is produced through error.üîΩAt that time,

original: de'i tshe / sgron ma yid byed der 'gyur ro //üîΩji ltar yul de rgyu yin pa de ltar snang ba yang yul la nye bar sbyor ba la reg pa med par nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba can dang / de bzhin du yid la byed pa yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe / sgron ma yid byed der 'gyur ro // ji ltar yul de rgyu yin pa de ltar snang ba yang yul la nye bar sbyor ba la reg pa med par nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba can dang / de bzhin du yid la byed pa yang 'gyur ro //
translated: attention would be the lamp.üîΩJust as that object is the cause, so too the appearance is the cause of the consciousness that experiences the object without contact through connection with the object. And so too is attention.

original: ji ltar nges par don gyi rnam pa dang 'dres pa'i shes pa dran pa yin pa de ltar na de bzhin du yid la byed pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nges par don gyi rnam pa dang 'dres pa'i shes pa dran pa yin pa de ltar na de bzhin du yid la byed pa la sogs pa nyams su myong ba dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as memory is the consciousness that is definitely mixed with the aspect of the object, so too attention and so on would be connected with experience.

original: gzhan yang gal te don gyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba don gyi rnam par zhen pa can gyi shes pa la dmigs par byed pa na dran pa yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar rnam par shes pa don dang ldan cig dran pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te don gyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba don gyi rnam par zhen pa can gyi shes pa la dmigs par byed pa na dran pa yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar rnam par shes pa don dang ldan cig dran pa /
translated: Moreover, if memory is that which causes the apprehension of the consciousness that has the aspect of the object, which is called the result of the object, then how could consciousness be said to be associated with the object?

original: de bzhin 'bras bu thams cad kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin 'bras bu thams cad kyang //
translated: In the same way, all results

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu dang lhan cig 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu dang lhan cig 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: are apprehended together with their causes, just as they are.

original: de phyir rdza mkhan la sogs pa //
analyzed: de phyir rdza mkhan la sogs pa //
translated: Therefore, without a potter, etc.,

original: med par bum pa dran mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med par bum pa dran mi 'gyur //
translated: a pot, etc., would not be remembered.

original: rdza mkhan dang 'khor lo la sogs pa yod na bum pa 'grub pa mthong ba de ltar na rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bum pa dran par byed pa na nges par dza mkhan la sogs pa dran par 'gyur gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang bumüîΩpa 'ba' zhig dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdza mkhan dang 'khor lo la sogs pa yod na bum pa 'grub pa mthong ba de ltar na rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bum pa dran par byed pa na nges par dza mkhan la sogs pa dran par 'gyur gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang bum pa 'ba' zhig dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When a pot is seen to be produced when a potter, wheel, etc., exist, then when a pot, which is the result of a potter, etc., is remembered, the potter, etc., are definitely remembered. In no way whatsoever is a pot remembered without the memory of the potter, etc.

original: de'i phyir don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa 'brel bas byas pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa 'brel bas byas pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness that has the aspect of an object is not apprehended by the connection that is produced.

original: ci ste yul gyi shes pa la yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag las khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa yin na /üîΩgang gis na rgyu nyid du mtshungs pa nyid yin na yang nges par don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pas shes pa la dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ci ste yul gyi shes pa la yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag las khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa yin na / gang gis na rgyu nyid du mtshungs pa nyid yin na yang nges par don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pas shes pa la dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the consciousness of an object has some distinction from attention, etc.,

original: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then why is it that, even though they are the same in being causes, consciousness is said to be the object-possessor because it definitely apprehends the aspect of the object, but not the others?üîΩThen,

original: de'i tshe / phul byung gang las shes pa ni //üîΩdon dang 'brel @233b pa ston pa yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe / phul byung gang las shes pa ni // don dang 'brel @233b pa ston pa yin //
translated: The object-possessor is taught to be that from which consciousness arises.

original: shes pa don dang 'brel pa la ston pa can du 'gyur ro zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: shes pa don dang 'brel pa la ston pa can du 'gyur ro zhes 'dod do //
translated: It is maintained that consciousness is the object-possessor because it arises in relation to the object.

original: de ni 'dra ba las gzhan cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni 'dra ba las gzhan cir 'gyur /
translated: What else is there besides that which is similar?

original: don dang 'dra ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par yul gyi phul du gyur pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par yul gyi phul du gyur pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no object-possessor that is distinct from that which is similar to the object.

original: 'dra ba nyid las 'khrul pas shes pa la don gyi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid las 'khrul pas shes pa la don gyi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable that consciousness superimposes the aspect of the object because of error in regard to that which is similar.

original: mtshe ma la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: mtshe ma la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin //
translated: It is like seeing twins, etc.

original: gzugs mtshungs pa'i mtshe ma dag las gcig mthong bas gzhan mthong ba na ngas sngon mthong ba de nyid 'di yin no zhes 'dra ba mthong ba las rtogs pa po de'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs mtshungs pa'i mtshe ma dag las gcig mthong bas gzhan mthong ba na ngas sngon mthong ba de nyid 'di yin no zhes 'dra ba mthong ba las rtogs pa po de'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one sees the other of a pair of twins who resemble each other, one thinks, ‚ÄúI see the one I saw before.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don dang 'dra ba mthong ba 'di la yang shes pa yul dang 'brel pa la sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang 'dra ba mthong ba 'di la yang shes pa yul dang 'brel pa la sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even in the case of seeing something that resembles an object, the cognition is mistaken with respect to the connection between the object and the cognition.

original: gzhan yang dang po nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yul dang nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa dag / gnyis med dngos yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dang po nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yul dang nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa dag / gnyis med dngos yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the cognition that first experiences the object and the aspect of the experience were nondual entities,

original: 'dzin par byed pa phyi ma de yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo gcig tu gnas par 'gyur gyi yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa phyi ma de yang nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo gcig tu gnas par 'gyur gyi yul dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa snang ba ma yin no //
translated: the subsequent cognition that apprehends them would also be a single entity of experience and not a cognition that appears in accordance with its object.

original: gnyis po ngo bo gcig la ni //
analyzed: gnyis po ngo bo gcig la ni //
translated: If the two were a single entity,

original: rnam par gnas pa shes pa de rtogs pa'i sems kyis shes pa 'dzin pa can gsum pas rnam par 'byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa shes pa de rtogs pa'i sems kyis shes pa 'dzin pa can gsum pas rnam par 'byed pa ma yin /
translated: the cognition that is the experience of the object would not be distinguished by the cognition that realizes it.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa la snang ba can tha dad par 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa la snang ba can tha dad par 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of the object does not apprehend the appearance as different,

original: rang nyid snang ba'i ngo bo gcig ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid snang ba'i ngo bo gcig ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the same nature of appearance as itself.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te 'on kyang yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i snang ba dang rang nyid nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te 'on kyang yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i snang ba dang rang nyid nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not so. Rather, the appearance of the cognition that has the aspect of the object and itself arise together.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba 'dzin pa can gyi blo gnyis pa ni'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba 'dzin pa can gyi blo gnyis pa ni'o //
translated: Therefore, the second cognition is the one that apprehends the experience.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: don bsre ba dang 'brel pa can //
analyzed: don bsre ba dang 'brel pa can //
translated: It is related to the mixing of objects.

original: don bsre ba can te don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa de ni don bsre ba dang 'brel cing ldan pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ro //üîΩblo dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: don bsre ba can te don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa de ni don bsre ba dang 'brel cing ldan pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ro // blo dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: The cognition that apprehends the aspect of the object is related to and possesses the mixing of objects.

original: blo gnyis pa de 'dra ba de la'o //
analyzed: blo gnyis pa de 'dra ba de la'o //
translated: The second cognition is like that.

original: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sngon sogs ngo bo ru /
analyzed: sngon sogs ngo bo ru /
translated: It is related to the entity of the past, etc.

original: mdun na snang bar gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pas nye bar gyur ba nyams su myong ba'i shes pas mdun na snang bar rtogs par 'gyur ba de ltar na blo tshul gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: mdun na snang bar gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pas nye bar gyur ba nyams su myong ba'i shes pas mdun na snang bar rtogs par 'gyur ba de ltar na blo tshul gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second mode of cognition is that which cognizes the object that appears before it, by the aspect of the object that is present, and by the experience of that object.

original: de lta min na gal te don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyis don dang 'dres pa'i yul gyi rnam par shes pa la dmigs par 'gyur gyi yul gyi rnam pa nye bar bsgyur ba las ni ma yin no //üîΩde'i tshe dang po'i nyams @234a * //
analyzed: de lta min na gal te don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyis don dang 'dres pa'i yul gyi rnam par shes pa la dmigs par 'gyur gyi yul gyi rnam pa nye bar bsgyur ba las ni ma yin no // de'i tshe dang po'i nyams @234a * //
translated: If it were not so, then the object would be cognized by the consciousness that is mixed with the object, by the result of the object itself, and not by the aspect of the object that is present.

original: su myong ba'i shes pa don gyi nus pa las byung ba can gcig phyir sbyor don dang yid kyi shes pa'i shes pas dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi shes pa la sogs pa dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: su myong ba'i shes pa don gyi nus pa las byung ba can gcig phyir sbyor don dang yid kyi shes pa'i shes pas dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi shes pa la sogs pa dang ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, the first experience of consciousness, which arises from the potentiality of the object, would not be related to the consciousness that arises later, such as the mental consciousness.

original: nyams su myong ba gzung bar bya ba don snga ma de dang 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gzung bar bya ba don snga ma de dang 'brel pa ni /
translated: The experience of the object that is apprehended is related to the previous object.

original: mthong med can phyi ma phyi ma med shes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong med can phyi ma phyi ma med shes pa'o //
translated: The subsequent consciousness does not see the previous object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don las 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: don las 'byung phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the object.

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa nyid ni don las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa nyid ni don las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of experience itself arises from the object.

original: rang dang 'brel pa can de dang sbyor bar byed kyi cig shos dang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang dang 'brel pa can de dang sbyor bar byed kyi cig shos dang ma yin te /
translated: It is connected with itself, and it is connected with that, but not with the other,

original: de dag ni de'i yul gyi don las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i yul gyi don las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those do not arise from the object that is their domain.

original: yul ma yin pa nyid kyis 'di mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa nyid kyis 'di mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not grasp that which is not its domain.

original: 'di ni shes pa phyi ma phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shes pa phyi ma phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: This is the establishment of the text beginning with ‚Äúthe subsequent cognition.‚Äù

original: de ltar na yul gyi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir /üîΩnges pa blo dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar na yul gyi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir / nges pa blo dang bcas pa ni //
translated: Thus, in order to explain the statement ‚Äúthe cognition of the object,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag nyid kyi rigs pa gzhan gyis ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag nyid kyi rigs pa gzhan gyis ston par mdzad do //
translated: he teaches another reasoning of his own, beginning with ‚Äúthat which is accompanied by the cognition of ascertainment.‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa /
translated: The cognition of blue, etc.,

original: nges par blo dang bcas par ni //
analyzed: nges par blo dang bcas par ni //
translated: is accompanied by the cognition of ascertainment.

original: lhan cig myong ni myong 'gyur pa //
analyzed: lhan cig myong ni myong 'gyur pa //
translated: It is experienced as experienced.

original: de dag las ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan nyid du yul gyi rnam pa gang gis ni grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag las ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan nyid du yul gyi rnam pa gang gis ni grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could the form of the object be established as being different from consciousness?

original: rgyu gang gis 'brub par 'gyur te ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis 'brub par 'gyur te ma yin no //
translated: By what cause would it be established? It would not be!

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang de nyams su myong ba dag ni lhan cig dmigs pa'i phyir tha dad par snang ba can nyid yin na yang gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang de nyams su myong ba dag ni lhan cig dmigs pa'i phyir tha dad par snang ba can nyid yin na yang gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Blue, etc. and the experience of them are perceived as different, because they are simultaneously perceived. The meaning is that they are one.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gang zhig gnyis su snang ba de ni don dam par tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gnyis su snang ba de ni don dam par tha dad pa yin te /
translated: whatever appears as two is ultimately different,

original: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag lta bu'o //
translated: like pleasure and pain.

original: yul dang shes pa'i rnam pa yang gnyis su snang ba yin no //
analyzed: yul dang shes pa'i rnam pa yang gnyis su snang ba yin no //
translated: The form of the object and the form of consciousness also appear as two.

original: de dang de ni yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar tha dad sngon po dang nyams su myong ba dag mthong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de ni yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar tha dad sngon po dang nyams su myong ba dag mthong par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not so, because the difference between blue, etc. and the experience of them is seen.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: skyes bu 'khrul pa'i rnam shes can rnams kyis //
analyzed: skyes bu 'khrul pa'i rnam shes can rnams kyis //
translated: By those who have a consciousness that is mistaken.

original: don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid tha dad pa med pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid tha dad pa med pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: But in reality, there is no difference in the nature of consciousness.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: zla gnyis med bzhin te /
analyzed: zla gnyis med bzhin te /
translated: Like the non-existence of two moons.

original: dper na zla ba gcig la mig 'khrul pa can gyis gzhan gnyis pa 'dzin pa de bzhin no zhes bya pas ma nges ba bstan to //
analyzed: dper na zla ba gcig la mig 'khrul pa can gyis gzhan gnyis pa 'dzin pa de bzhin no zhes bya pas ma nges ba bstan to //
translated: For example, one who has an eye disease apprehends a second moon, but it does not exist.

original: ci ste ma 'khrul pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i khyad par gzung bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe ma 'khrul pa nyid ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste ma 'khrul pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i khyad par gzung bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe ma 'khrul pa nyid ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But if you maintain that the distinction ‚Äúby those who are not deceived‚Äù is to be taken, then at that time, non-deception itself is not established,

original: mchog mthong ba can ma yin pa thams cad kyis 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog mthong ba can ma yin pa thams cad kyis 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because all those who do not see the highest truth are deceived.

original: myong @234b ba'i nges pa yod ma yin /
analyzed: myong @234b ba'i nges pa yod ma yin /
translated: There is no certainty of experience.

original: gcig tu dmigs pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu dmigs pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no certainty of the apprehension of one.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?üîΩBlue and yellow are different,

original: sdo ser ngag gi tha dad dag / ji ltar sngon po dang ser po dag dus gcig tu dmigs pa yin na yang /
analyzed: sdo ser ngag gi tha dad dag / ji ltar sngon po dang ser po dag dus gcig tu dmigs pa yin na yang /
translated: but just as blue and yellow are apprehended at the same time,

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang gcig tu dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang gcig tu dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, there is no certainty of the apprehension of one.

original: 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dpe bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dpe bstan to //
translated: This is the example of dissimilarity.

original: sngon po dang de nyams su myong ba de dag ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang de nyams su myong ba de dag ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: Blue and the experience of blue are not like that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar don 'ga' zhig ni myong ba med pa'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar don 'ga' zhig ni myong ba med pa'am /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause sometimes one sees something without experiencing it,

original: don dmigs pa na de nyams su myong ba med par 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'ga' zhig mthong ba yin no //üîΩdon med can yang mthong ba ni //
analyzed: don dmigs pa na de nyams su myong ba med par 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'ga' zhig mthong ba yin no // don med can yang mthong ba ni //
translated: or one sees something without experiencing it when the object is perceived.üîΩBut one never sees a consciousness without an object.

original: rnam par shes pa don med pa can don gyi rnam par nye bar bsgrub pa med par myong bar 'gyur ba ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don med pa can don gyi rnam par nye bar bsgrub pa med par myong bar 'gyur ba ma mthong ngo //
translated: One never sees a consciousness without an object, without the appearance of an object.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs 'grub pa'i mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs 'grub pa'i mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus he concludes the proof of the reason.

original: de'i phyir don dang de dmigs pa de dag tha dad med ces bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang de dmigs pa de dag tha dad med ces bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Therefore, the object and the experience of the object are not different. This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang dmigs pa na nges par dmigs par 'gyur ba na de ni de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang dmigs pa na nges par dmigs par 'gyur ba na de ni de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: When one definitely experiences something when it is perceived, then that is it.

original: dper na de'i rang nyid kyi ngo bo 'am zla ba gnyis pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de'i rang nyid kyi ngo bo 'am zla ba gnyis pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like its own nature or a second moon.

original: de dmigs pa la yang de nyams su myong ba nges par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de dmigs pa la yang de nyams su myong ba nges par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And that which is perceived in the object is definitely perceived as experienced. This is a natural inference.

original: khyab pa yang tshad ma rnam par nges pa las rgyas bar bstan zin pa de ltar na 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: khyab pa yang tshad ma rnam par nges pa las rgyas bar bstan zin pa de ltar na 'dir ma spros so //
translated: As for the pervasion, it has been extensively explained in the Ascertainment of Valid Cognition. Thus, I will not elaborate on it here.

original: de'i phyir shes dus snang ba can //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes dus snang ba can //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of an object

original: don ni shes las tha dad par bzlog par shin tu dka' ba yin zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: don ni shes las tha dad par bzlog par shin tu dka' ba yin zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: is very difficult to refute as being different from consciousness. This is the conclusion.

original: dbang po la sogs par /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs par /
translated: Regarding the sense faculties and so on,

original: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod na yang //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod na yang //
translated: even when other causes exist,

original: dbang po'i blo rnams med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo rnams med pa'i phyir //
translated: the cognitions of the sense faculties do not occur.

original: don du snang ba can gyi blo med par 'di ni de tsam gyi rgyu can yin pa de ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa las /üîΩrgyu yi tha dad rjes dpog 'gyur //
analyzed: don du snang ba can gyi blo med par 'di ni de tsam gyi rgyu can yin pa de ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa las / rgyu yi tha dad rjes dpog 'gyur //
translated: This is the reason why the cognition appearing as an object does not exist. Thus, from the cessation of the effect,üîΩthe difference of the cause is inferred.

original: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The difference of the other cause is inferred.

original: rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de ni 'dir don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de ni 'dir don yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the other cause is the object,

original: de ltar yang gal te don zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar yang gal te don zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: then in that case, if the so-called object is established,

original: de rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yin par 'gyur gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yin par 'gyur gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: it is to be understood through inference, not through direct perception.

original: 'di de ltar yin na yang ji ltar yid la 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa las tha dad par grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di de ltar yin na yang ji ltar yid la 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa las tha dad par grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, how is it not established as different from the consciousness that is desired by the mind?

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don de gang gi tshe 'grub par 'gyur /üîΩgal te rnam par shes pa smra bas mtshungs @235a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don de gang gi tshe 'grub par 'gyur / gal te rnam par shes pa smra bas mtshungs @235a * //
translated: In that case, when is the external object established?

original: pa de ma thag rkyen las nges par mi smra na'o //
analyzed: pa de ma thag rkyen las nges par mi smra na'o //
translated: If the consciousness-advocate does not definitely state that it arises from the immediately preceding condition,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i snying po yid la byed pas byis pa'i blo rnams kyis 'jug pa'i nges pa mi smra ba na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i snying po yid la byed pas byis pa'i blo rnams kyis 'jug pa'i nges pa mi smra ba na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that the consciousness that appears as the desired object arises from the maturation of the latent tendencies, and the childish minds do not definitely state that it arises from the attention.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu ldog pa dang mi ldog pa ni de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bag chags sad pa dang ma sad pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu ldog pa dang mi ldog pa ni de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bag chags sad pa dang ma sad pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the cessation and noncessation of the effect is due to the activation and nonactivation of the latent impressions that generate such consciousness.

original: 'bras bu don du snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med pa las rgyu bye brag med par yod do zhes rjes su dpog pa na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu don du snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med pa las rgyu bye brag med par yod do zhes rjes su dpog pa na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: When one infers the existence of consciousness that has the appearance of an object as its effect, without any distinction of cause, it is simply the establishment of what has already been established.

original: de lta ma yin na ma grub pa yin pa de de ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang gang las don rjes su dpog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ma grub pa yin pa de de ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang gang las don rjes su dpog par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, then it would be unestablished. In that case, from what would one infer the object, even from the cessation of the effect?

original: gal te gang gi tshe phyir rol gyi don med pa'i tshe blo sa bon las myu gu snang ba 'khrul pa nyid yin pas na med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de byed pa po nyid ma yin zhing 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe phyir rol gyi don med pa'i tshe blo sa bon las myu gu snang ba 'khrul pa nyid yin pas na med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de byed pa po nyid ma yin zhing 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: If, when there is no external object, the appearance of a sprout from a seed is simply an error of the mind, then it is nonexistent, and therefore it is not a producer and not an effect.

original: de ji ltar sa bon las myu gu skye ba zhes bya ba'i byed pa po rnam par gzhag pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar sa bon las myu gu skye ba zhes bya ba'i byed pa po rnam par gzhag pa yin /
translated: How is the agent posited in the statement ‚ÄúThe sprout arises from the seed‚Äù?

original: sa bon dang myu gu snang ba dag la ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu snang ba dag la ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed and the sprout do not exist as cause and effect in the appearance of the seed and the sprout.

original: de bzhin du me dang du bar smra ba dag la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du me dang du bar smra ba dag la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, for those who assert that fire and smoke exist as cause and effect, the state of cause and effect is not tenable.

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: They are not the object and the subject of understanding.

original: yang phyi rol gyi don yod na /
analyzed: yang phyi rol gyi don yod na /
translated: Moreover, if external objects exist,

original: phyi rol gyi me yod pa yin zhing de du ba'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na du ba me'i go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi me yod pa yin zhing de du ba'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na du ba me'i go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: if external fire exists and it is the cause of smoke, then smoke would be the evidence of fire.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la yang du ba rtogs pa'i dus me yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la yang du ba rtogs pa'i dus me yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: But in the case of mere consciousness, fire does not exist at the time smoke is cognized.

original: shes par byed pa du ba las me grub pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa ji ltar gnas pa yin /
analyzed: shes par byed pa du ba las me grub pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa ji ltar gnas pa yin /
translated: In that case, how could fire be established from smoke, the evidence?

original: phyi rol gyi don la ni byed pa po la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad 'bad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la ni byed pa po la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad 'bad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But in the case of external objects, all the principles of the agent, etc., are refuted.

original: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no such fault in our system.üîΩThus, it is said:

original: 'di ltar / sa bon las ni myug skye dang // zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sa bon las ni myug skye dang // zhes bya ba /
translated: From seed arises sprout.

original: de ltar phyi rol don rten can byed pa por gnas pa gang yin pa dang du ba las me grub pa zhes shes par byed pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang gal te phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med par dngos por rtogs pa
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol don rten can byed pa por gnas pa gang yin pa dang du ba las me grub pa zhes shes par byed pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang gal te phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med par dngos por rtogs pa
translated: Thus, the one who is the external object-based agent and the one who is the conventional designation ‚Äúfire is established from smoke‚Äù are, if one understands that they are not dependent on external objects,

original: la brten nas /
analyzed: la brten nas /
translated: based on that.

original: de yi ngo bor snang ba can //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor snang ba can //
translated: The one who appears in the form of that

original: myu gu la sogs par snang ba //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs par snang ba //
translated: The one who appears as sprout, etc.

original: de ltar nges 'byung ba /
analyzed: de ltar nges 'byung ba /
translated: Thus, it is ascertained.

original: sa bon la sogs par bye brag tu snang ba'i blo las de ma thag @235b tu 'byung zhing skye ba'i myu gu la sogs par snang ba can gyi blo gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs par bye brag tu snang ba'i blo las de ma thag @235b tu 'byung zhing skye ba'i myu gu la sogs par snang ba can gyi blo gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who immediately arises and is born from the mind that appears as seed, etc., is the one who appears as sprout, etc.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i /
translated: The one who is like that

original: blo ston pas ni rtogs byed na //
analyzed: blo ston pas ni rtogs byed na //
translated: But if the cognition is the object,

original: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod //
translated: what contradiction is there?

original: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩji ltar sa bon las myu gu zhes bya ba skye ba dngos po la so sor des pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no // ji ltar sa bon las myu gu zhes bya ba skye ba dngos po la so sor des pa'i phyir /
translated: There is none at all.üîΩJust as, in the case of the arising of the sprout from the seed, the seed is the cause of the sprout because it is the basis of the cognition of the sprout,

original: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa'i 'dod pa de ltar sa bon du snang ba can gyi blo rgyur gyur pa yod na myu gur snang ba can gyi shes pa byung bar gyur pa rtogs pa na tshad ma dang 'gal ba med pa nyid yin no
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa'i 'dod pa de ltar sa bon du snang ba can gyi blo rgyur gyur pa yod na myu gur snang ba can gyi shes pa byung bar gyur pa rtogs pa na tshad ma dang 'gal ba med pa nyid yin no
translated: in the same way, when the cognition of the sprout arises, if there is a cause, the cognition of the seed, then there is no contradiction with valid cognition.

original: // phyi rol gyi don la brten pa can gyi rnam par gzhag pa can 'di ni ston par dka' ba nyid yin te don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // phyi rol gyi don la brten pa can gyi rnam par gzhag pa can 'di ni ston par dka' ba nyid yin te don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This theory based on external objects is difficult to teach, because the object is not established.

original: rnam par gzhag pa gcig por nas rnam par gzhag pa gzhan la brten pa las byung ba can gyi nyes pa yang 'di la 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar nag gnod pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gcig por nas rnam par gzhag pa gzhan la brten pa las byung ba can gyi nyes pa yang 'di la 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar nag gnod pa ci zhig yod /
translated: When the theory is established in one way, the fault arising from relying on another theory does not apply here. What harm is there in that?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: du ba mes bskyed 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: du ba mes bskyed 'gyur ba min //
translated: smoke does not arise from fire.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i blo la brten nas shes par byed pa rnam par 'jog pa 'gal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i blo la brten nas shes par byed pa rnam par 'jog pa 'gal ba nyid yin te /
translated: The establishment of the cognition that is the means of understanding, based on the cognition explained earlier, is contradictory.

original: 'di ltar du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa sngar 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa sngar 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, the cognition that appears as smoke occurs earlier,

original: phyis mer snang ba'i shes pa byung bar gyur na snga ma ni 'bras bu ma yin zhing phyi ma ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis mer snang ba'i shes pa byung bar gyur na snga ma ni 'bras bu ma yin zhing phyi ma ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: and the cognition that appears as fire occurs later. The former is not the effect, and the latter is not the cause.

original: de'i tshe phyi rol gyi me med na mi snang ba can gyi shes pa nang nyams su myong ba yin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyi rol gyi me med na mi snang ba can gyi shes pa nang nyams su myong ba yin na /
translated: At that time, if the cognition that does not appear as external fire is experienced internally,

original: gang las du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa 'bras bur rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa 'bras bur rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: from what is the cognition that appears as smoke understood to be the effect?

original: de ltar na du ba ni me las skye ba nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na du ba ni me las skye ba nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, smoke would not arise from fire.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu las /
translated: Therefore, from the effect,

original: du ba las rgyu ma mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba las rgyu ma mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the cause is not understood from smoke.

original: de ltar na shes par byed pa gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shes par byed pa gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the means of understanding is not established.

original: ci ste yang du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa mer snang ba can gyi shes pa'i rgyur rtogs pa de'i tshe du bar snang ba'i shes pa de rgyu dag ni yin na yang //
analyzed: ci ste yang du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa mer snang ba can gyi shes pa'i rgyur rtogs pa de'i tshe du bar snang ba'i shes pa de rgyu dag ni yin na yang //
translated: But if you think that the consciousness that appears as smoke is the cause of the consciousness that appears as fire, then that consciousness that appears as smoke is the cause of the consciousness that appears as fire.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu'i rjes su dpog pa thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu'i rjes su dpog pa thob par 'gyur na /
translated: But when the effect is inferred from the cause,

original: de'i tshe yang rgyu rnams las 'bras bu ma nges pa'i phyir gang las nges par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang rgyu rnams las 'bras bu ma nges pa'i phyir gang las nges par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: then at that time, since the effect is not ascertained from the cause, from what would it be ascertained?

original: rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir shes par byed pa gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir shes par byed pa gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: Since there is no inference, the proof is not established. This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: de la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: In response to that, the verse begins with ‚ÄúIn that case, . . .‚Äù

original: de la'ang du ba las me rjes su dpog par 'dod na du bar snang ba'i blo rtogs kyi ming can mer snang ba'i blo nyid ni rtogs par 'gyur @236a * //
analyzed: de la'ang du ba las me rjes su dpog par 'dod na du bar snang ba'i blo rtogs kyi ming can mer snang ba'i blo nyid ni rtogs par 'gyur @236a * //
translated: In that case, if you assert that fire is inferred from smoke, the cognition that appears as smoke is the cognition that appears as fire, which is called ‚Äúrealization.‚Äù

original: ro ; / ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ro ; / ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bag chags gsal bar sad pa dag / blo gang las bag chags gsal bar sad pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bag chags gsal bar sad pa dag / blo gang las bag chags gsal bar sad pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: is the cognition that is the clear manifestation of the latent potentialities.

original: mer snang ba can gyi ma 'ongs pa'i blo nyid kyi go bar byed par 'gyur gyi me ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mer snang ba can gyi ma 'ongs pa'i blo nyid kyi go bar byed par 'gyur gyi me ni ma yin no //
translated: The future cognition that appears as fire is what is to be inferred, not the fire.

original: mer snang ba can gyi da ltar blo bsgrub bas rtogs pa ma yin na gang gis na de'i tshe du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa ni mes bskyed ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mer snang ba can gyi da ltar blo bsgrub bas rtogs pa ma yin na gang gis na de'i tshe du bar snang ba can gyi shes pa ni mes bskyed ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: If the cognition that appears as fire in the present is not established by a means of valid knowledge, then at that time the cognition that appears as smoke is not produced by fire,

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cognition with that kind of aspect.

original: 'bras bu gang las rgyu rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang las rgyu rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: From what effect would the cause be inferred?

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de rung bag chags snying po can //üîΩmer snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i bag chags kyi snying po skye ba'i rgyu dang rten rgyud gang la yod pa de nyid /
analyzed: de rung bag chags snying po can // mer snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i bag chags kyi snying po skye ba'i rgyu dang rten rgyud gang la yod pa de nyid /
translated: it is suitable to have a latent potentiality with a core.üîΩThe stream in which there is the cause of the arising of the core of the latent potentiality that is suitable to produce the consciousness that appears as fire

original: du bar snang ba can gyi blo'i //
analyzed: du bar snang ba can gyi blo'i //
translated: is the cause of the arising of the core of the latent potentiality that is suitable to produce the cognition that appears as smoke.

original: sems kyi rgyu ni gsal bar byed //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ni gsal bar byed //
translated: The cause of the mind is the illumination.

original: skyed par byed kyi gang ci yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed kyi gang ci yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the producer, not just anything.

original: rgyu de'i phyir me las du ba yin /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir me las du ba yin /
translated: Because of that cause, smoke is from fire.

original: me las du ba byung ba de ltar na bag chags gsal bar sad pa'i snying po can mer snang ba'i blo rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me las du ba byung ba de ltar na bag chags gsal bar sad pa'i snying po can mer snang ba'i blo rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When smoke arises from fire, in that way, because of the inference of the mind appearing as fire, which has the essence of the activation of the latent impressions,

original: rgyu las 'bras bu dpog pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu dpog pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that the form is uncertain, because the effect is inferred from the cause.

original: mkhas rnams ji skad bshad pa'i phyi rol gyi don khas mi len pa la rtsod pa de dag yod /
analyzed: mkhas rnams ji skad bshad pa'i phyi rol gyi don khas mi len pa la rtsod pa de dag yod /
translated: The wise do not accept external objects as explained, but those arguments exist.

original: med pa ma yin te tshad mar mi slu bas spong bar rigs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: med pa ma yin te tshad mar mi slu bas spong bar rigs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: They are not nonexistent, because it is reasonable to abandon them with valid cognition that is nondeceptive.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa'i rtsod pa la ltos pa med par phyi rol nyid kyi don la brten nas ni khas blangs nas kyang blo'i tshul gnyis brjod yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa'i rtsod pa la ltos pa med par phyi rol nyid kyi don la brten nas ni khas blangs nas kyang blo'i tshul gnyis brjod yin no //
translated: In that way, without relying on a real argument, having accepted external objects, the two modes of the mind are stated.

original: gcig myong ba nges phyir /
analyzed: gcig myong ba nges phyir /
translated: Because of the ascertainment of the experience of one.

original: gcig tu dmigs par nges pa'i phyir bshad ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs kyis tshul gnyis po de yang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu dmigs par nges pa'i phyir bshad ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs kyis tshul gnyis po de yang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is certain that they are focused on one thing, the two modes that were just explained are also established by the reason.

original: 'dir yang tshul gnyis grub par bya ba la ci don la sogs par rigs pa gzhan ston par mdzad de don las de shes ba skye bar 'gyur ba der snang yang yod min yul gyi rnam pa can med pa de'i tshe /

translated: Here, in order to establish the two modes, another reasoning is taught, such as the meaning. When consciousness arises from the meaning, it appears as that, but it does not exist. When the aspect of the object does not exist,

original: don tha dad med ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: don tha dad med ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: because the meaning is not of a different nature,

original: yid kun ni /
analyzed: yid kun ni /
translated: all minds

original: ngo bo gcig pa dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa dag tu 'gyur //
translated: become of one nature.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i don can don gcig gi ngo bo'i yul gang la yod pa de ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i don can don gcig gi ngo bo'i yul gang la yod pa de ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of that is that it exists in the object that has the nature of a single meaning.

original: de rnam pa gcig pa can nyid kyi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnam pa gcig pa can nyid kyi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: That becomes consciousness that has a single aspect.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar dbang po'i khyad par gyis dbang po'i 'gyur bas gsal mi gsal 'dren ma la sogs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar dbang po'i khyad par gyis dbang po'i 'gyur bas gsal mi gsal 'dren ma la sogs pa /
translated: In this way, due to the difference in sense faculties, by the change in sense faculties, unclear, clear, mixed, etc.,

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang 'dren ma @236b la sogs pa snang ba tha dad 'dzin pa'i shes pa don gcig las snang 'gyur /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang 'dren ma @236b la sogs pa snang ba tha dad 'dzin pa'i shes pa don gcig las snang 'gyur /
translated: The consciousness that apprehends the different appearances of clarity, unclarity, and so on is the same as the consciousness that apprehends the different appearances of the object.üîΩ

original: mang po cig car snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang po cig car snang bar 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe shes pa yin pa de'i tshe de dag don ma yin zhing gang gi tshe don yin pa de'i tshe shes pa ma yin pa de ltar shes pa'i dus na don med pa'i phyir shes pa nyid yul gyi rnam pa der snang bas
