translated: Thus, when they are consciousness, they are not objects, and when they are objects, they are not consciousness. In that case, because objects do not exist at the time of consciousness, consciousness itself appears in the aspect of the object.

original: na blo'i tshul gnyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: na blo'i tshul gnyis grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the two modes of cognition are established.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so,

original: sgra dang mar me la sogs pa dag ni rnam par shes pa dang rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang mar me la sogs pa dag ni rnam par shes pa dang rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: but sound, flame, and so on produce moments that are of the same type as consciousness.

original: de bas na sgra la sogs pa'i de ma thag pa'i shes pa rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: de bas na sgra la sogs pa'i de ma thag pa'i shes pa rgyur gyur pa /
translated: Therefore the consciousness that immediately precedes sound and so on is the cause.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga mas bskyed pa de'i gsal ba grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga mas bskyed pa de'i gsal ba grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The previous moment of sound and so on generates it.

original: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is the establishment of the manifestation.

original: 'di ltar shes pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rigs mthun pa mar me la sogs pa'i skad cig ma gang yin pa rang yod pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rigs mthun pa mar me la sogs pa'i skad cig ma gang yin pa rang yod pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir
translated: That is illogical because when consciousness exists, the homogeneous type that has the character of arising does not benefit the consciousness that has the character of arising when it exists.

original: de las de mngon par gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las de mngon par gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not manifested from that.

original: ci ste yang de'i rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma de phan 'dogs ba ma yin na yang gsal bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste yang de'i rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma de phan 'dogs ba ma yin na yang gsal bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you assert that even though the moment of the homogeneous type does not benefit it, it is manifested,

original: gzhan yang de shes pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i rigs mtshungs ba'i don gang yin pa de gsal ba yin par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de shes pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i rigs mtshungs ba'i don gang yin pa de gsal ba yin par 'dod pa na /
translated: then at that time, when the object that is generated by the cause of consciousness is asserted to be manifested,

original: don kun 'ga' zhig phan 'dogs par mi byed pa gang yin pa de dang des gsal @240b bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don kun 'ga' zhig phan 'dogs par mi byed pa gang yin pa de dang des gsal @240b bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it does not benefit some objects, then it would not illuminate them.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no difference between those that are illuminated and those that are not illuminated, since it does not benefit them.

original: de ltar na yang ma yin pa de'i phyir de yang gsal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang ma yin pa de'i phyir de yang gsal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not so, therefore it does not illuminate them.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te rgyu nges yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu nges yin na /
translated: if it is a cause,

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ma yin pas bye brag med pa yin na yang don thams cad gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ma yin pas bye brag med pa yin na yang don thams cad gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then even though there is no difference between those that are illuminated and those that are not illuminated because it does not benefit them, all objects would be illuminated.üîΩBut that which is generated by its cause and is of a similar type is illuminated.

original: rang gi rgyus bskyed pa de dang rigs mthun pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges ba gang yin pa de'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu'i don gang yin pa de nyid kyis rigs mthun pa de yang bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rgyus bskyed pa de dang rigs mthun pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges ba gang yin pa de'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu'i don gang yin pa de nyid kyis rigs mthun pa de yang bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the certainty in that? Whatever is the cause of the consciousness of that object, that very object generates that which is of a similar type.

original: rgyu gcig gis byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gcig gis byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is produced by a single cause.

original: de'i rgyu de'i de ma thag tu yod pa don dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la bstan ma thag pa'i rtog pa de yang med pa ste rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i de ma thag tu yod pa don dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la bstan ma thag pa'i rtog pa de yang med pa ste rung ba ma yin no //
translated: And the idea just expressed, that the cognition is in the nature of a simultaneous occurrence with the object, is also impossible.

original: rgyu gcig gis bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gcig gis bskyed pa yin no //
translated: It is produced by a single cause.

original: shes bya las shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin na yul du gyur par snang ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes bya las shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin na yul du gyur par snang ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If the object does not help the cognition, it is not reasonable that it should appear as the object.

original: de lta ma yin na dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyus kyang rigs pa'i dbang po bskyed pa gang yin pa de yang yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyus kyang rigs pa'i dbang po bskyed pa gang yin pa de yang yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the sense faculty, which is the cause of the sense cognition, would also be the object.

original: de bas na gang zhig gang las gang gi rnam par skye ba nges byas shes pa rang gi yul gyis bskyed par gyur pa de med kyang gal te rang gi yul du gyur ba'i don shes pa yod pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig gang las gang gi rnam par skye ba nges byas shes pa rang gi yul gyis bskyed par gyur pa de med kyang gal te rang gi yul du gyur ba'i don shes pa yod pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na
translated: Therefore, if a cognition is produced from an object, it is reasonable that it be produced in the aspect of that object. But if the object does not exist at the time the cognition of the object occurs, then the object cannot be the cause of the cognition.

original: yang don du snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: yang don du snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Thus, the object cannot be the cause of the cognition.üîΩAnd if the object does not exist at the time the cognition of the object occurs, then the object cannot be the cause of the cognition.

original: yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pas skye ba'i phyir don te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pas skye ba'i phyir don te /
translated: It is an object because it arises in the aspect of the object.

original: gsal ba zhes brjod pa yin gyi de dang rigs mthun pa dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can gyi don yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes brjod pa yin gyi de dang rigs mthun pa dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can gyi don yang ma yin no //
translated: It is called manifest because it is similar to that, but it is not an object that occurs simultaneously with it.

original: 'di ltar / lhan cig skyes pa'i don gzhan ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lhan cig skyes pa'i don gzhan ni //
translated: Thus, a different object that is co-present

original: rgyu gcig pa can gyis kyang shes pa la rnam pa mi byed 'dra ba mi byed do //
analyzed: rgyu gcig pa can gyis kyang shes pa la rnam pa mi byed 'dra ba mi byed do //
translated: does not cause an aspect in consciousness, because it is not similar.

original: 'dra ba mi byed pa'i phyir dang / dus sngar 'dra ba nyid skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dra ba mi byed pa'i phyir dang / dus sngar 'dra ba nyid skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not cause an aspect and because it is similar only when it arises earlier,

original: rang rnam pas shes la rnam med lhan cig skye ba'i don gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang rnam pas shes la rnam med lhan cig skye ba'i don gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can a consciousness that is without aspect manifest an object that is co-present?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩphan 'dogs byed med phyir na ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / phan 'dogs byed med phyir na ste /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it does not assist.

original: mi byed pa'i phyir yul ma yin te /
analyzed: mi byed pa'i phyir yul ma yin te /
translated: It is not an object because it does not function.

original: 'di gsal ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di gsal ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not manifest.

original: skad cig ma rnams ni 'jig pa'i phyir bstan pa ma yin pa dag la gsal bar mi 'gyur mod kyi rtag pa dag ni 'di 'grub pa yin no snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di yang legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma rnams ni 'jig pa'i phyir bstan pa ma yin pa dag la gsal bar mi 'gyur mod kyi rtag pa dag ni 'di 'grub pa yin no snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di yang legs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not right to think that the momentary things are not manifested because they are destroyed, and that the permanent things are manifested because they are established.

original: de ltar na /üîΩrdo rjes rdo sogs don dag kyang //
analyzed: de ltar na / rdo rjes rdo sogs don dag kyang //
translated: Thus,

original: brtan pa zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang rang gi @241a * //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang rang gi @241a * //
translated: even the diamond and so on, which are held to be permanent,üîΩare not essentially different from the nature of the capacity to produce their effects.

original: 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin las 'pho ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ltar na rang gi 'bras bu byed pa la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen 'ga' zhig la yang ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin las 'pho ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ltar na rang gi 'bras bu byed pa la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen 'ga' zhig la yang ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: In that case, they would not depend on any other cooperative conditions in order to produce their effects,

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because they would not depend on anything else.

original: rgyu'i phyir gtong ba med bar 'gro ba kun gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i dus bzhin du rang gi yul can gyi shes pa thams cad ni cig car rang nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir gtong ba med bar 'gro ba kun gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i dus bzhin du rang gi yul can gyi shes pa thams cad ni cig car rang nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, like the time when there is no effect that is desired by all transmigrators, all cognitions that have objects would arise simultaneously.

original: nus pa med na yang phul du byung ba byar med pa nyid kyi phyir phyis kyang nus pa med pa yin pas na 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa med na yang phul du byung ba byar med pa nyid kyi phyir phyis kyang nus pa med pa yin pas na 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not capable, then it is not capable later on either, because it is not possible for it to be capable at a later time.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin rim gyis shes pa skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin rim gyis shes pa skyed pa yin na /
translated: If consciousness arises in sequence, in accordance with the conditions,

original: lhan cig byed pas phan 'dogs phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pas phan 'dogs phyir /
translated: then it is because of the assistance of the cooperating conditions.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje dang rdo la sogs pa de dag rim bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje dang rdo la sogs pa de dag rim bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the diamond and the stone, etc., arise in sequence.

original: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba rdo rje dang rdo la sogs pa byed pa bo dang byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba rdo rje dang rdo la sogs pa byed pa bo dang byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis /
translated: The diamond and the stone, etc., which are the cause of the arising of consciousness, are not by nature the agent or the instrument.

original: skad cig re re'i tha dad brjod cing ston par byed rjod pa de ltar na skad cig ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: skad cig re re'i tha dad brjod cing ston par byed rjod pa de ltar na skad cig ma nyid yin no //
translated: The momentariness of consciousness is expressed and demonstrated by the expression ‚Äúmoment-to-moment difference.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma nyid yin na yang /

analyzed: te zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgag pa gsungs so //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /

analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yod pa'i dus na /
translated: ‚ÄîIf that were the case, then when the apprehending consciousness exists,

analyzed: yul gyi blo 'gag pa yin te /
translated: the object-¬≠cognizing consciousness has ceased,

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yul gyi blo 'gag pa yin na /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yul gyi blo 'gag pa yin na /
translated: because it is momentary. If the object-¬≠cognizing consciousness has ceased,üîΩthen at that time,

analyzed: de'i tshe / dngos po can gyi blo yis ni //

analyzed: yul gyi shes pa dang 'dra bas shes pa 'gag pa nyid kyi phyir shes pa med pa de ci ltar myong ba yin te /
translated: Because it is like the consciousness of an object, how can the non-existence of consciousness be an experience?

original: ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na shes ba gzhan gyis blo nyams su myong ba ma yin te bdag nyid kyis nyams su myong ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the mind is not experienced by another mind, because we do not accept that it experiences itself.

original: blo phyi ma des rang ngo bo blo snga ma las byung ba dang 'dra ba mtshan nyid can bdag nyid myong med phyir de rgyu de'i phyir /
analyzed: blo phyi ma des rang ngo bo blo snga ma las byung ba dang 'dra ba mtshan nyid can bdag nyid myong med phyir de rgyu de'i phyir /

original: shes pa 'am shes bya'i'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'am shes bya'i'o //

analyzed: de ltar na nyams su myong ba med par shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na don dud snang ba dang ldan pa /

analyzed: phyi rol du mngon du phyogs @243b pa ste gzung ba nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du nyams su myong ba'i blo 'di yang phyi rol tu mngon du phyogs par snang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'di ltar yul blo la'ang 'dzin par byed pa'i blo //

analyzed: nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de rtag tu bdag la rtogs par bya ba la /

original: gal te rang gi blo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang gi blo nyid yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: phyi rol tu kha bltas pas 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it would not engage in external objects when it is mindful of its own mind.

original: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that were so,

original: gang gi tshe rang gi blo dran par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi blo dran par byed pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol nyid du dran pa las so sor gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa 'di yang mi rung ngo //

analyzed: gzhan yang don dang 'dra ba bdag nyid nyams su myong ba ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the mind does not experience itself in the form of an object,

analyzed: gang zhig yul du snang gang de //

original: don gang yin pa de shes pa //
analyzed: don gang yin pa de shes pa //

original: des myong ma yin shes pa'ang thob //
analyzed: des myong ma yin shes pa'ang thob //

original: de ltar na gang gis don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du gyur ba myong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i dbang gis des don de so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du gyur ba myong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i dbang gis des don de so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /

original: gal te de 'dra bas myong ba //
analyzed: gal te de 'dra bas myong ba //

analyzed: gzhan yod ces ni 'dod 'gyur na //

analyzed: don dang 'dra ba las nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can gyi ngo bo'i myong ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no //

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /

analyzed: don dang 'dra ba tsam gyis don nyams su myong ba yin no zhe na /

analyzed: gal te de nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'dra ba thams cad phan tshun dge //
translated: then all likenesses would experience each other.

original: myong ba dag ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: myong ba dag ni thob par 'gyur //

analyzed: don dang 'dra bas thams cad phan tshun mtshungs ba yod pa de ltar de dag gcig la gcig myong bar 'gyur na /

analyzed: 'dod pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa yin no //

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /

analyzed: gal te blo 'dra de myong yin //

analyzed: 'dra ba tsam don nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /

analyzed: blo'i ngo bo 'dra ba gang yin pa de don myong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If the essence of the cognition is similar to that, then it is the experience of the object.

original: bas don nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bas don nyams su myong ba ma yin no //

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /

analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyis 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar shes ba nyams su myong ba bdag nyid myong ba yin pas na /

analyzed: nyams su myong ba de rang nyid de ltar gsal ba yin no //

translated: If the clarity that is the nature of experience is experienced, why is it conventionally said that external blue and so on are experienced?

original: rang bzhin gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe transformation of the nature‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gyur pa ste /

translated: The experience of the nature of blue and so on is the experience of the nature of that. The experience of that is not the experience of an existent object. The world superimposes external objects and is confused.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi don myong ba ni 'di yin no zhes rnam par chad pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi don myong ba ni 'di yin no zhes rnam par chad pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of the experience of external objects as if they were discrete.

original: rang bzhin gyur pa de'i ngo bo myong ba'i sgro 'dogs 'khrul pa las /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyur pa de'i ngo bo myong ba'i sgro 'dogs 'khrul pa las /
translated: The transformation of the basis is the elimination of the error of superimposition that experiences the entity of that.

original: rgyu'i phyir ji ltar sgro btags pa bzhin /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir ji ltar sgro btags pa bzhin /
translated: Because it is the cause, it is as it is imputed.

original: sngo sogs myong bar grags yin gyi //üîΩsngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa yin gyi gzhan gyi bdag nyid de /üîΩsngon po la sogs pa phyi rol tu gyur pa /

translated: It is renowned that blue and so on are experienced.

original: myong las nyams su myong ba'i rgyus ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: myong las nyams su myong ba'i rgyus ni ma yin no ;
translated: The convention is made that blue and so on are experienced, but it is not that the experience of blue and so on is caused by the experience of something else that is external to the mind.

original: / gal te blo sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: / gal te blo sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the mind is the entity of blue and so on,

original: blo ni sngo sogs dngos yin na //
analyzed: blo ni sngo sogs dngos yin na //
translated: then the mind is the entity of blue and so on.

analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i rnam pa ma gtogs par 'dra ba med pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir /

analyzed: blo'i don dang 'dra bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: blo ni sngo sogs dngos yin na //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'dabs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'dabs par byed do //

original: de ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na /

analyzed: blo ni sngo sogs dngos min na //

original: yul du snang ba nyid ma yin na /

analyzed: de ji ltar grub pa yin pa de brjod par bya'o zhe na /

analyzed: don dang 'dra bas don nyams su myong ba la ci zhig rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rgyu'i phyir shes pa /

analyzed: sngo sogs nyams su myong bar 'dod // khas len to // de ltar nyams myong ngo bo'i phyir //

analyzed: de bas na nyams su myong ba 'dra bas byas pa ma yin no //

translated: And when one sees some object, but is distracted by another object, it is not certain that one experiences that object, and so it is not established that the object is the object of experience.

analyzed: su myong ba nges pa dang ma nges pa'i dbang gis yul dang yul ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: nyams su myong bar bya ba myong ba yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dra ba'i dbang gis nyams su myong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang nyid las yin no //

translated: In the same way, the arising of pain, etc. is experience; thus, experience is not something else.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum med pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum med pa ni //
translated: Moreover, if direct perception does not exist,

original: blo ni rtags las rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: blo ni rtags las rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: the cognition would be known from a sign.

original: 'on te blo mngon sum ma yin na rtags las rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te blo mngon sum ma yin na rtags las rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if cognition is not direct perception, it would arise from a sign.

original: rtags de yang dbang po'am 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: rtags de yang dbang po'am 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'am /
translated: Is this sign the sense faculty, or form, etc.

original: rang blo nyid dam /
analyzed: rang blo nyid dam /
translated: Or is it the mind itself?

original: yid byed snga ma sngar gyi nus pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yid la byed pa rtags su 'gyur //
analyzed: yid byed snga ma sngar gyi nus pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yid la byed pa rtags su 'gyur //
translated: Or is it the mental activity of the prior mind consciousness that possesses the prior potential?

original: grangs yongs su chad pa 'di tsam nyid yin na /
analyzed: grangs yongs su chad pa 'di tsam nyid yin na /
translated: If the number of these is definitely limited to just this,

original: ci'i phyir bdag dang yid la sogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag dang yid la sogs pa ma yin /
translated: why not the self, the mental faculty, etc.?

original: 'di ltar 'di'i rgyu 'bras tshogs pa la 'brel pa can gzhan yod mi na re zhig blo'i rgyu nus pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i rgyu 'bras tshogs pa la 'brel pa can gzhan yod mi na re zhig blo'i rgyu nus pa'am /
translated: In this way, in the collection of causes and effects, there is no other related entity.

original: mthong ba can ni dbang po dang don dan yid la byed pa ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na de las gzhan pa'i snang ba sogs pa'i nus pa yod na yang mig gam gzugs gang yang @251a * //
analyzed: mthong ba can ni dbang po dang don dan yid la byed pa ma yin no // de ltar na de las gzhan pa'i snang ba sogs pa'i nus pa yod na yang mig gam gzugs gang yang @251a * //
translated: The cause of the mind is either the potential or the sense faculty and object, which are seen.

original: rung ba med pa las rnam par shes pa med pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rung ba med pa las rnam par shes pa med pa mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, even if there is a potential for the appearance of something else, consciousness does not arise from anything other than the eye and form.

original: de bzhin du rnal ba la sogs pa'i blo la yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po dang yul da ni  rang rig 'bras bu ldog pa rgyu nus pa mthong ba can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal ba la sogs pa'i blo la yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po dang yul da ni  rang rig 'bras bu ldog pa rgyu nus pa mthong ba can yin no //
translated: Likewise, in the case of a mind that is distracted, etc., the power of the immediately preceding condition is not seen.

original: mig la sogs pa yod na yang rnam par shes pa snga ma yul gzhan la rnam par g-yeng ba dang thogs pa dang gnyid log pa dang smyo ba dang brgyal ba sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu phyi ma mi skye ba dang 'khrul ba la sogs pa mthong
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yod na yang rnam par shes pa snga ma yul gzhan la rnam par g-yeng ba dang thogs pa dang gnyid log pa dang smyo ba dang brgyal ba sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu phyi ma mi skye ba dang 'khrul ba la sogs pa mthong
translated: Even when the eye, etc. exist, the subsequent consciousness is not seen to arise when the prior consciousness is distracted by another object, or when it is obstructed, or when it is in a state of sleep, intoxication, fainting, etc.

original: ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa snga ma nus pa mthong ba can yin no //
analyzed: ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa snga ma nus pa mthong ba can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the power of the prior consciousness is seen.

original: mig la sogs pa 'bras bu'i tshogs pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'bras bu'i tshogs pa /
translated: The collection of causes of the eye, etc.

original: de ni 'di ma yin gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel pa can bdag yid phrad pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ma yin gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel pa can bdag yid phrad pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: is not this, but is related as cause and effect, and the self, contact of the mind, etc. do not exist.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what is this known?

original: nus pa mthong ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa mthong ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because the power is not seen.

original: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu thag nye ba na yod pa na yang blo yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe gzhan yang nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu thag nye ba na yod pa na yang blo yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe gzhan yang nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind does not arise even when the proximate cause is present, then something else would be the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na nus pa mthong ba med pa can yang de'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod na rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nus pa mthong ba med pa can yang de'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod na rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, and if one maintained that the cause is not seen to have the capacity, then the causes would be infinite.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rtags de dag gi nang nas re zhig de la dbang po min /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rtags de dag gi nang nas re zhig de la dbang po min /
translated: Among the reasons stated, first, it is not a sense faculty.

original: blo'i rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i rtags ma yin no //
translated: It is not a sign of the mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'khrul phyir / gang gi tshe dbang po yod pa de'i tshe blo ma yin te gnyid log pa dang / brgyal ba dang rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nas blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir / gang gi tshe dbang po yod pa de'i tshe blo ma yin te gnyid log pa dang / brgyal ba dang rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nas blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of error. When the sense faculty exists, the mind does not exist, because there is no mind in the states of sleep, faint, distraction, and so on.

original: de'i bye brag sgrib g-yogs med pa la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bye brag sgrib g-yogs med pa la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a particular state of the sense faculty, such as the absence of obscuration, because it is not a sign of the mind.

original: shes par mi nus pa can nyid kyis 'di yang rtags nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par mi nus pa can nyid kyis 'di yang rtags nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a sign because it is not capable of being known.

original: gal te yul la 'jug pa na yang dbang po'i bye brag ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa rtogs pa rang gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul la 'jug pa na yang dbang po'i bye brag ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa rtogs pa rang gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If, when the object is engaged, the specific sense faculty, such as the absence of obstruction, is cognized, then the mind is self-cognizant.

original: de la blo la sogs pa gzhan pa de gang yin /
analyzed: de la blo la sogs pa gzhan pa de gang yin /
translated: What is that other thing, such as the mind, that is cognized?

original: de yang ma grub pa de ltar na dbang po rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa de ltar na dbang po rtags ma yin no //
translated: That is not established. Thus the sense faculty is not a sign.

original: de bzhin don rtags ma yin te //
analyzed: de bzhin don rtags ma yin te //
translated: In the same way, the object is not a sign.

original: 'khrul ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is mistaken.

original: gang gi tshe gang gang la don yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang gang la don yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When something does not exist for someone, it is not a sign for them.

original: de lta ma yin na don yod pa tsam gyis blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba na ni don thams cad yod pa nyid na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don yod pa tsam gyis blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba na ni don thams cad yod pa nyid na /
translated: If it were otherwise, when the mind arises merely through the existence of the object, since all objects exist,

original: skyes bu thams cad la nye ba dang bskal pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir blo thams cad rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad la nye ba dang bskal pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir blo thams cad rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: all minds would be inferred, because proximity and remoteness are not possible for all people.

original: blo yid byed dag kyang rang nyid shes pa yin /
analyzed: blo yid byed dag kyang rang nyid shes pa yin /
translated: The mind and mental factors are also self-cognizant.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa des kyang 'di nyid kyi rgyu tshol @251b par byed pa ni mi rnyed pa de ltar na de yang 'grub mi 'gyur shes pa la rtags nyid med /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa des kyang 'di nyid kyi rgyu tshol @251b par byed pa ni mi rnyed pa de ltar na de yang 'grub mi 'gyur shes pa la rtags nyid med /
translated: Also, since it is the nature of consciousness, when it searches for its own cause, it is not found. In that case, it would not be established. Consciousness does not have a sign.

original: de ltar na rtags thams cad ni rang gi bdag nyid la shes pa la ltos nas rtags rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa yin na blo dang yid la byed pa de dag la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na de dag ni rtags nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rtags thams cad ni rang gi bdag nyid la shes pa la ltos nas rtags rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa yin na blo dang yid la byed pa de dag la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na de dag ni rtags nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if all signs are causes that are known in dependence on their own nature, they do not exist in the mind and mental factors. In that case, they are not signs.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so.

original: gal te don gsal yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te don gsal yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the object is clear,

original: don ni rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni rtags ma yin no //
translated: the object is not a sign.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: don gyis gsal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis gsal ba yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object is clear,

original: de la don gyis gsal ba 'di gang yin /
analyzed: de la don gyis gsal ba 'di gang yin /
translated: what is this clarity of the object?

original: gal te yul dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yul dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is the object that is observed,

original: gsal ba de shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsal ba de shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: is that clarity not consciousness?

original: de nang de gal te grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de nang de gal te grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is established as that,

original: blo gzhan gang ma grub pa yin par gyur na don gang la rtags yin par 'dod /
analyzed: blo gzhan gang ma grub pa yin par gyur na don gang la rtags yin par 'dod /
translated: If the other mind is not established, then with respect to what object is the reason asserted?

original: gang tshe de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang tshe de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: When it is not suitable to be anything at all,

original: don ni don gsal ba gsal ba ste //
analyzed: don ni don gsal ba gsal ba ste //
translated: The object is the manifestation of the object.

original: don gsal ba rtags yin gyi don tsam ni ma yin no zhes rtog pa gang yin pa de yang don gsal ba bkag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don gsal ba rtags yin gyi don tsam ni ma yin no zhes rtog pa gang yin pa de yang don gsal ba bkag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The manifestation of the object is the reason, not the mere object.

original: de ltar na gal te gsal ba'i khyad par du byas pa'i don yang ma grub pa yin pa de ltar na blo khyad par can gyi don gang las blo grub pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te gsal ba'i khyad par du byas pa'i don yang ma grub pa yin pa de ltar na blo khyad par can gyi don gang las blo grub pa yin /
translated: If the object that is distinguished by the manifestation is not established, then from what object does the special mind arise?

original: de'i phyir don gsal ba nyams myong ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gsal ba nyams myong ma yin la /
translated: Therefore the manifestation of the object is not an experience.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa /
translated: It is not direct perception.

original: de gsal nges pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsal nges pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because the manifestation is not ascertained.

original: gsal ba de don gyi gsal ba nyid yin pa nges pa med par de ltar na gsal ba gsal zhes bya ba don la gsal ba ma yin pa gang gi rtags su 'gyur /
analyzed: gsal ba de don gyi gsal ba nyid yin pa nges pa med par de ltar na gsal ba gsal zhes bya ba don la gsal ba ma yin pa gang gi rtags su 'gyur /
translated: The manifestation is not ascertained to be the manifestation of the object. In that case, what is the reason for saying that the manifestation is the manifestation of the object?

original: ci ste don gyi gsal ba blo'am don rtogs pas gsal bar mi 'dod na gang gis na blo ma grub pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste don gyi gsal ba blo'am don rtogs pas gsal bar mi 'dod na gang gis na blo ma grub pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur /
translated: But if you do not assert that the clarity of the object is the clarity of the cognition that realizes the object, then how could the error of cognition being unestablished arise?

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the case?üîΩThe particular of the object

original: don gyi bye brag 'ga' de nyid //
analyzed: don gyi bye brag 'ga' de nyid //
translated: becomes the clarity itself.

original: bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gsal ba 'dod na ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gsal ba 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that the particular of the object becomes the clarity itself,

original: de dang de yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang de yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: that is also not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: 'di ltar / skye ba dang ni 'jig med pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skye ba dang ni 'jig med pa'i //
translated: Because the object

original: don la bye brag cung zad med //
analyzed: don la bye brag cung zad med //
translated: has no distinctions whatsoever.

original: phyi rol gyi don brtan pa nyid yin la skye ba dang 'jig med pa yin pa de ltar na 'pho ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i khyad par can 'di'i de 'dra ba'i byad par gang la yod pa yin /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don brtan pa nyid yin la skye ba dang 'jig med pa yin pa de ltar na 'pho ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i khyad par can 'di'i de 'dra ba'i byad par gang la yod pa yin /
translated: If external objects are stable and do not arise and disintegrate, then they would not have the distinction of not transferring and not arising.

original: shes pa 'ga' zhig gis gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa'i gsal ba rnam par gzhag pa yin /
analyzed: shes pa 'ga' zhig gis gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa'i gsal ba rnam par gzhag pa yin /
translated: The clarity that is the object of any cognition is posited as the object.

original: de 'dod na'ang /
analyzed: de 'dod na'ang /
translated: If you assert that,

original: ci ste don de skye ba dang 'jig par 'dod pa de'i tshe shes pa so so ba la don skad cig 'jig par thal bar 'gyur /üîΩrnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma @252a * //
analyzed: ci ste don de skye ba dang 'jig par 'dod pa de'i tshe shes pa so so ba la don skad cig 'jig par thal bar 'gyur / rnam par shes pa ni skad cig ma @252a * //
translated: But if you assert that the object arises and is destroyed, then it follows that the object would be momentary for each consciousness.

original: nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa re re skye ba la de'i rgyur gyur pa'i don yang 'jig pa thob par rgyur 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa re re skye ba la de'i rgyur gyur pa'i don yang 'jig pa thob par rgyur 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is momentary, it is established that the object that serves as the cause of the arising of each consciousness is also destroyed.

original: de'i phul du byung ba bskyed pa las rgyu'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdon gsal ba'i bye brag blo'i rtags nyid du 'dod pa de yang shes pa rtags su 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de'i phul du byung ba bskyed pa las rgyu'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // don gsal ba'i bye brag blo'i rtags nyid du 'dod pa de yang shes pa rtags su 'gyur ram /
translated: Because it is the cause of the generation of its effect.üîΩThe assertion that the difference in the clarity of the object is the sign of consciousness is also untenable.

original: shes min rtags su 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis su 'gyur grang na /üîΩgal te don gyi bye brag shes pa rtags yin pa de'i tshe de'i yul can gyi shes pa yongs su bcad med par /
analyzed: shes min rtags su 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis su 'gyur grang na / gal te don gyi bye brag shes pa rtags yin pa de'i tshe de'i yul can gyi shes pa yongs su bcad med par /
translated: Is it the sign of consciousness or is it the sign of something that is not consciousness?

original: don gyi bye brag de shes zhes bya ba de gang las /
analyzed: don gyi bye brag de shes zhes bya ba de gang las /
translated: If the difference in the clarity of the object is the sign of consciousness, then how can you say that the object is known without ascertaining the consciousness that is its subject?

original: de shes pa shes pa de med na 'di pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de shes pa shes pa de med na 'di pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If that cognition of cognition did not exist, this would not exist.

original: de ltar na yul dmigs pa la dmigs par byed pa na 'ga' zhig don la dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yul dmigs pa la dmigs par byed pa na 'ga' zhig don la dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when one observes the object that is observed, one observes the object.

original: de dang de yang dmigs pa mngon sum nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: de dang de yang dmigs pa mngon sum nyid ma yin na /
translated: And if that is not the direct perception of the object,

original: yod pa ma yin pa na don shes pa rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa na don shes pa rtags ma yin no //
translated: then the cognition of the object is not a sign.

original: gal te yang de'i shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir don shes pa 'di yin no zhes nges par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te yang de'i shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir don shes pa 'di yin no zhes nges par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: Moreover, if the cognition of that is not established, then it is not ascertained that this is the cognition of the object. In that case,

original: yang de la de shes pa nyid don dam par yod pa yin pas na rtags su 'gyur ro snyam pa'i rtog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de la de shes pa nyid don dam par yod pa yin pas na rtags su 'gyur ro snyam pa'i rtog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one would not even imagine that it is a sign because the cognition of that is ultimately existent.

original: de ltar na don dam par de nyid shes pa nyid shes pa la ma grub pa na grub par mi 'gyur zhing rtags la go bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya bas de go bar byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na don dam par de nyid shes pa nyid shes pa la ma grub pa na grub par mi 'gyur zhing rtags la go bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya bas de go bar byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the cognition of that is not established in the cognition of that, it would not be established. And if the cognition of that is not a sign, then the cognition of that would not be a sign.

original: 'on kyang de ltar nges pa la shes pa'i bye brag can gyi don de go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar nges pa la shes pa'i bye brag can gyi don de go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: However, in order to ascertain that, the object that is the specific content of consciousness must be understood.

original: shes pa rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is the evidence.

original: de bas na shes pa nyid yongs su bcad pa med par yang /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa nyid yongs su bcad pa med par yang /
translated: Therefore, even without the determination of consciousness,

original: de ni go byed ji ltar yin /
analyzed: de ni go byed ji ltar yin /
translated: how can that be the evidence?

original: ci ste shes pa ma yin pa rtags yin pa de ltar na yang don gang dag ma mthong ba de dag yin /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa ma yin pa rtags yin pa de ltar na yang don gang dag ma mthong ba de dag yin /
translated: If it is not consciousness that is the evidence, then it is the objects that are not seen that are the evidence.

original: don de dag ni ma mthong ba can no //
analyzed: don de dag ni ma mthong ba can no //
translated: Those objects are the ones that are not seen.

original: lta ba por mthong bar 'dod pa las gzhan gyis ni skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: lta ba por mthong bar 'dod pa las gzhan gyis ni skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: From the perspective of the one who is the seer, other than that, some person

original: mthong ba la lar mthong ba de dag ma mthong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la lar mthong ba de dag ma mthong ba nyid yin no //
translated: sees in some places, but does not see those that are seen.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can mthong bar khas len na thams cad kyis thams cad la don thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can mthong bar khas len na thams cad kyis thams cad la don thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one accepts that there is such a type of seeing, it follows that everyone would see everything.

original: don de mi shes pa'i bye brag de skyes bu gzhan mthong ba la yang gzhan gyi yod de ma shes pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: don de mi shes pa'i bye brag de skyes bu gzhan mthong ba la yang gzhan gyi yod de ma shes pa nyid yin na /
translated: The particular of that object is not seen by another person, because the other person does not know it.

original: skyes bu gcig la yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir rang blo @252b rtogs 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes bu gcig la yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir rang blo @252b rtogs 'gyur /
translated: But it is not certain that it exists for one person.üîΩTherefore, it is not reasonable to assert that the object is not seen because of the mind.üîΩThe mind would be inferred from itself.

original: don de ma mthong ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de'i yang rang nyid blo rjes su dpag par 'gyur na rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don de ma mthong ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de'i yang rang nyid blo rjes su dpag par 'gyur na rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable to infer the mind from itself.

original: don chos yan gar de las ni /
analyzed: don chos yan gar de las ni /
translated: From the object alone,

original: 'o na ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?üîΩThe mind is not an inference

original: rang gi chos la ltos med can /
analyzed: rang gi chos la ltos med can /
translated: From a property that does not depend on itself.

original: skyes bu rjes su dpog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos la ltos pa med pa las /
analyzed: skyes bu rjes su dpog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos la ltos pa med pa las /
translated: The mind is not an inference from a property that does not depend on itself, that is, from a property called consciousness that is the nature of an inference of a person.

original: blo ni rjes dpog ma yin no //
analyzed: blo ni rjes dpog ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not an inference.

original: srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible.

original: ci ste yang don gyi chos las ni mi 'gyur mod kyi rang nyid la brten pa'i chos 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni rtags yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang don gyi chos las ni mi 'gyur mod kyi rang nyid la brten pa'i chos 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni rtags yin no //
translated: But if the mind is not an inference from the object, then it is an inference from a property that depends on itself.

original: de las blo'i rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las blo'i rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not logical that the realization of the mind arises from that.

original: de ltar na chos de ni mngon sum yin na rtags su 'gyur bar rigs pa yin gyi skyes bu'i chos 'ba' zhig mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na chos de ni mngon sum yin na rtags su 'gyur bar rigs pa yin gyi skyes bu'i chos 'ba' zhig mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ma yin na /
translated: If that is so, then it is logical that the sign is the object that is directly perceived, not the person alone, because the object is directly perceived.

original: gang gis rang gi blo'i rjes su dpog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi blo'i rjes su dpog par 'gyur /
translated: By what means would one infer the person?

original: gzhan yang rang blo las skyes bu gzhan dang chos rang gi yul zhig yod na gang yin mngon sum blo rgyu ste rtags yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang blo las skyes bu gzhan dang chos rang gi yul zhig yod na gang yin mngon sum blo rgyu ste rtags yin par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if the person and the object of the person exist as other than the mind, then the mind that is the cause of the sign would be the sign.

original: gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the person does not exist as other.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu rang gi chos kyang rtags nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de'i blo skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa de nyid las skye ba yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu rang gi chos kyang rtags nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de'i blo skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa de nyid las skye ba yin nam /
translated: Moreover, if the person‚Äôs own attributes are imagined to be the sign, do they arise from the collection of causes that produces the mind?

original: 'o na te gzhan las yin /
analyzed: 'o na te gzhan las yin /
translated: Or do they arise from something else?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po la blo dang / rgyu mtshungs pa las skyes pa can /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po la blo dang / rgyu mtshungs pa las skyes pa can /
translated: In the first case, the mind and the sign would be the same.

original: blo la chos de'i tha dad gang las yin te tha dad pa nyid med do //
analyzed: blo la chos de'i tha dad gang las yin te tha dad pa nyid med do //
translated: How could the mind be different from that entity? It is not different.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du rnam par nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du rnam par nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the nature of the effect is ascertained as the nature of the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na yul la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yul la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the object and so on would not be ascertained.

original: 'di ltar de 'dra ba las skyes pa de ni de dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bshad pa'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de 'dra ba las skyes pa de ni de dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bshad pa'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: In this way, that which arises from such and such is similar to that.

original: blo bzhin du de yang ma grub pa nyid yin pas na rtags nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: blo bzhin du de yang ma grub pa nyid yin pas na rtags nyid ma yin no //
translated: If the nature is explained in this way, then, like the mind, it is not established, and therefore it is not a reason.

original: gzhan skyes de yang 'khrul pa can /üîΩci ste blo'i /
analyzed: gzhan skyes de yang 'khrul pa can / ci ste blo'i /
translated: The arising of another is also mistaken.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan las de skye bar 'dod pa de'i tshe 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan las de skye bar 'dod pa de'i tshe 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is asserted that it arises from a cause other than the collection of causes of the mind, then it would be mistaken because there would be no connection.

original: gzhan yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i blo gzhan du gyur pa'i rtags las rjes su dpog pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i blo gzhan du gyur pa'i rtags las rjes su dpog pa na /
translated: Moreover, when inferring from a sign that is different from the object to a mind that is different,

original: de'i rtags ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rtags ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: its sign would be changed through the effect.

original: de la blo'i 'bras bur 'gyur na yul la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la blo'i 'bras bur 'gyur na yul la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the effect of cognition, then it is an object, etc.

original: de ltar na /üîΩgzugs sogs yul ni lnga po dang // gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i ming @253a * //
analyzed: de ltar na / gzugs sogs yul ni lnga po dang // gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i ming @253a * //
translated: Thus,

original: can ma gtogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag dang dmigs pa dag ste blo ma gtogs pa de'i 'bras bu gzhan nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: can ma gtogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag dang dmigs pa dag ste blo ma gtogs pa de'i 'bras bu gzhan nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
translated: apart from the five objects such as form, and apart from the faculties such as the eye, etc., and their objects, there is no other effect of cognition that is indicated.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu de tsam yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu de tsam yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there is only that much effect.

original: de la 'bras bu nyid du brtag par bya ba de dag gi nang nas gnyis ni dbang po 'das /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu nyid du brtag par bya ba de dag gi nang nas gnyis ni dbang po 'das /
translated: Among those that are to be considered as effects, two are not faculties.

original: dbang po dang dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are the faculty and the object.

original: re zhig de rtags ma yin zhing blo ma grub na /
analyzed: re zhig de rtags ma yin zhing blo ma grub na /
translated: If the effect is not a sign and cognition is not established,

original: blo 'bras bu grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo 'bras bu grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then cognition is not established as an effect.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa nyid las dbang po grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa nyid las dbang po grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the faculty is established from the mere cessation of the effect.

original: blo ma grub na de mi grub //
analyzed: blo ma grub na de mi grub //
translated: If cognition is not established, it is not established.

original: de ltar na de'i rtags ma yin zhing blo yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rtags ma yin zhing blo yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not a sign of that, nor is it cognition.

original: 'bras bu yang gang 'ga' zhig ldog pa tsam las dbang po grub pa bzhin du spyi blo'i rgyu nyid yin par shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang gang 'ga' zhig ldog pa tsam las dbang po grub pa bzhin du spyi blo'i rgyu nyid yin par shes par mi bya'o //
translated: And the result is not the cause of the cognition of the universal, like the sense faculty that is established from the mere cessation of something.

original: 'on kyang blo'i ngo bo nyid kyis blo 'di'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang blo'i ngo bo nyid kyis blo 'di'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood that the result of this cognition is the nature of cognition itself.

original: de lta ma yin na blo'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na blo'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be the nature of cognition.

original: 'on kyang rgyu cung zhig kyang yod ces bya bar 'grub par 'gyur gyi blo grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu cung zhig kyang yod ces bya bar 'grub par 'gyur gyi blo grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is established that there is some cause, not that the cognition is established.

original: blo'am dbang po de dang de mngon sum nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na dbang po'am blo gang las rjes su dpog pa yin /
analyzed: blo'am dbang po de dang de mngon sum nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na dbang po'am blo gang las rjes su dpog pa yin /
translated: If that sense faculty or cognition does not exist in the present, then from what sense faculty or cognition is it inferred?üîΩAnd it is not the case that form, etc. are the evidence,

original: gzugs la sogs pas rtags su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / gzugs la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pas rtags su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang yod pa ma yin te / 'di ltar / gzugs la sogs pa yi //
translated: because:üîΩThe five objects such as form

original: don lnga dag la gzugs mthong skyes //üîΩgang yin gcig kyang mthong ba med //
analyzed: don lnga dag la gzugs mthong skyes // gang yin gcig kyang mthong ba med //
translated: are seen by the eye that arises from karma.

original: blo las skyes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: blo las skyes gang yin pa'o //
translated: None of them are seen by the one that arises from cognition.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of a thing is it?

original: rnam gzhan gsal ba srid pa ci //
analyzed: rnam gzhan gsal ba srid pa ci //
translated: How can there be a clear manifestation of something else?

original: rnam pa gzhan du gsal zhing spangs pa gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du gsal zhing spangs pa gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat has a clear manifestation of something else‚Äù should be connected with the phrase ‚Äúthat has a clear manifestation of something else.‚Äù

original: blo med par gang zhig yod pa ma yin te 'khrul pa med pa can zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo med par gang zhig yod pa ma yin te 'khrul pa med pa can zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the case that anything exists without a mind, for it is said that it is free of error.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis shes med nges pa med pa gang yin pa de rtags yin par /üîΩkun du brtags pa 'jig rten 'das //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis shes med nges pa med pa gang yin pa de rtags yin par / kun du brtags pa 'jig rten 'das //
translated: The sign that is ascertained to be without a mind and without a clear manifestation, in the manner that has just been explained,üîΩis imagined to be transcendent.

original: tha snyad 'di 'jig rten las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad 'di 'jig rten las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
translated: This convention is completely transcendent.

original: de de ltar na sna tshogs pa tha dad pa skye ba can yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa yin na rtags yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na sna tshogs pa tha dad pa skye ba can yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa yin na rtags yin no //
translated: Thus, although there are various different things that arise, the state of being a cause and an effect exists.

original: de 'bras bu nyid ma grub pa de ltar na blo'i rtags nyid yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'bras bu nyid ma grub pa de ltar na blo'i rtags nyid yin pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not established as an effect, then it is not a sign of the mind,

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another aspect is not possible.

original: khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having accepted this, we will now discuss it.

original: rtags yod pa dag yin na yang //
analyzed: rtags yod pa dag yin na yang //
translated: Even if the reason exists,

original: rtags de dang lhan cig blo de mthong med na ji ltar rtags yin /
analyzed: rtags de dang lhan cig blo de mthong med na ji ltar rtags yin /
translated: if the cognition is not seen together with that reason, how can it be a reason?

original: rtags kyi rjes @253b su 'gro ba mthong ba med par ldog pa tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir shes pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtags kyi rjes @253b su 'gro ba mthong ba med par ldog pa tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir shes pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is not the case that the mere reversal without seeing the concomitance of the reason is what causes understanding, it is not a cognition. This is the meaning.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par yang dag par yang gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par yang dag par yang gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even without concomitance, there is no manifestation.

original: gal te bdag la blo 'grub par 'gyur pa de'i sngon du song ba can gyi las kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs pa mthong ba las de las gzhan la blo rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag la blo 'grub par 'gyur pa de'i sngon du song ba can gyi las kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs pa mthong ba las de las gzhan la blo rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: If the cognition of self were established, then from seeing the movement of karma that precedes it, the cognition of others would be inferred from that.

original: 'di ltar rang gi blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na rjes su dpag pa de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na rjes su dpag pa de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, if one's own cognition is not direct perception, that inference does not exist,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no concomitance.

original: de yang ldog pa can spyod pa'i skabs su ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ldog pa can spyod pa'i skabs su ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be shown in the section on the reversal of activity.

original: ci'i phyir rtags yod na yang rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtags yod na yang rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that even when there is a reason, there is no conception?

original: rtags dag ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtags dag ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe reasons . . .

original: ma mthong ba la gsal byed min //
analyzed: ma mthong ba la gsal byed min //
translated: . . . are not manifest in the unseen.‚Äù

original: gang dang lhan cig 'di'i 'brel par bzung ba med pa de 'brel pa ma mthong ba can de ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig 'di'i 'brel par bzung ba med pa de 'brel pa ma mthong ba can de ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not apprehended as related to this is not manifest in the unseen.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi rtags gang gis bdag nyid la blo sgrub par 'dod pa'i rtags de nyid las gzhan la blo grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi rtags gang gis bdag nyid la blo sgrub par 'dod pa'i rtags de nyid las gzhan la blo grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Granted that this is so, but the very reason by which one wishes to establish the cognition in oneself is established for another from that very reason.

original: de sgrub pas gzhan rjes su 'gro ba las bdag nyid la rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de sgrub pas gzhan rjes su 'gro ba las bdag nyid la rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Since it is established for him, it is an inference for oneself from the universal concomitance established for another.

original: de de ltar na rtags de nyid las ni sngar 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dag la rjes su dpag pa las sngar 'di ni grub pa yin par khas len na rjod par byed na'o //
analyzed: de de ltar na rtags de nyid las ni sngar 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dag la rjes su dpag pa las sngar 'di ni grub pa yin par khas len na rjod par byed na'o //
translated: If that is so, then it is established for him from that very reason, and it is accepted that it is an inference for oneself from the universal concomitance established for another.

original: re zhig bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la yang dpe nyid du blo nye bar 'god pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: re zhig bsgrub par bya ba gzhan la yang dpe nyid du blo nye bar 'god pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: But the cognition that is placed in proximity to the example, even in regard to another object to be established,üîΩ. . .

original: dpe gzhan bsgrub bar bya ba nyid yin gyi de lta min na gal te der dpe med par 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dpe gzhan bsgrub bar bya ba nyid yin gyi de lta min na gal te der dpe med par 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is not so, then if it is established without an example,

original: 'dir yang de bzhin du ci'i phyir grub par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin du ci'i phyir grub par mi 'gyur /
translated: why is it not established in the same way here?

original: de ltar na gzhan yang dpe med pa can grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan yang dpe med pa can grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not established without an example.

original: de'i phyir dpe gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro na /
translated: If it follows another example,

original: de'ang zhes bya thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: de'ang zhes bya thug med 'gyur //
translated: then that would be an infinite regress.üîΩTherefore, since it is not established in one, it is not established in all.

original: des na gcig la yang ma grub pa'i phyir thams cad la rtog pa med pa de ltar na 'ga' zhig la yang rjes su 'gro ba grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig la yang ma grub pa'i phyir thams cad la rtog pa med pa de ltar na 'ga' zhig la yang rjes su 'gro ba grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not established in any.

original: de ltar na ste de'i phyir rang nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ba'i blo las don grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na ste de'i phyir rang nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ba'i blo las don grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the cognition that arises as the nature of self-clarity establishes the object,

original: don las de blo ji ltar yang grub pa min no //
analyzed: don las de blo ji ltar yang grub pa min no //
translated: but the object does not establish the cognition at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ma grub na yul dmigs pa grub par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ma grub na yul dmigs pa grub par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If it is not established, the object is not established.

original: don rang nyid rab tu grub pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: don rang nyid rab tu grub pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because the object itself is not established at all.

original: de ltar na re zhig bdag la blo rtogs pa ma @254a * //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig bdag la blo rtogs pa ma @254a * //
translated: Thus, first of all, the cognition of the self is not direct perception.

original: yin no // bdag la mngon sum blo ni mthong nas kyang /üîΩbdag la mngon sum gyi blo de'i 'bras bur gyur pa g-yo 'gul brjod la sogs /
analyzed: yin no // bdag la mngon sum blo ni mthong nas kyang / bdag la mngon sum gyi blo de'i 'bras bur gyur pa g-yo 'gul brjod la sogs /

original: g-yo 'gul dang rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo 'gul dang rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: the movement, speech, etc.üîΩof the self would not be the effect of that cognition of the self.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gdong gi mdangs dang kha dog 'gyur ba mthong ba gang yin pa des /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gdong gi mdangs dang kha dog 'gyur ba mthong ba gang yin pa des /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the observation of the change in the expression and complexion of the face.

original: gzhan sems rjes dpog mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan sems rjes dpog mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not infer the mental state of another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag ste blo la 'brel pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ste blo la 'brel pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no observation of a connection between the self and the cognition.

original: bdag la blo mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin pa de'i g-yo 'gul la sogs pa 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'brel pa gzung ba can de las gzhan la blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag la blo mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin pa de'i g-yo 'gul la sogs pa 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'brel pa gzung ba can de las gzhan la blo rjes su dpog par 'gyur na /
translated: If the movement, etc. of the self were the effect of the cognition of the self, then one would infer the cognition of the self in another person from the observation of the connection between the self and the cognition.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid la de'i rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid la de'i rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But since there is no other means of knowing the cognition of the self,

analyzed: gang las de dag dang lhan cig 'brel pa gzung ba can gyi g-yo 'gul la sogs pa las rjes su dpog par 'gyur /

original: yid kyi blo yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi blo yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: But the mental cognition is not inferred.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don rtogs sgrub pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs sgrub pa med phyir ro //

translated: If the apprehension of a single part of a syllable, which is extremely small, is momentary and disintegrates, then the experience of that immediately after is the cognition of a different part of the syllable.

original: blo gzhan gyis so //
