original: de'i phyir don du snang ba gnyis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir cig car don shes pa dang shes de shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don du snang ba gnyis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir cig car don shes pa dang shes de shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the appearance of the object and the cognition of it are not realized simultaneously, the cognition of the object and the cognition of that cognition do not occur simultaneously.

original: don shes pa dang de shes pa cig car skye ba yin na don du snang ba dang 'dra bar shes pa snang ba rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba /üîΩsnang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rtsod pa'i skyon gang yin par 'di gdon par dka'/
analyzed: don shes pa dang de shes pa cig car skye ba yin na don du snang ba dang 'dra bar shes pa snang ba rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba / snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rtsod pa'i skyon gang yin par 'di gdon par dka'/
translated: If the cognition of the object and the cognition of that cognition were to occur simultaneously, the appearance of the cognition would be realized in the same way as the appearance of the object.üîΩThis is difficult to refute, difficult to respond to,

original: lan gdab par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: lan gdab par dka' ba yin no //
translated: in the case of the objection regarding the variety of appearances.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / don dang don gyi yid dag ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don dang don gyi yid dag ni //
translated: although the object and the cognition of the object

original: myong ba'i rim bzhin skye na yang //
analyzed: myong ba'i rim bzhin skye na yang //
translated: arise in sequence,

original: don gyi shes pa dang shes pa dag rim bzhin skye bar 'dod na snang ba gnyis rnam par ma chod par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: don gyi shes pa dang shes pa dag rim bzhin skye bar 'dod na snang ba gnyis rnam par ma chod par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If you assert that the object-cognition and the cognition of that arise sequentially, then the two appearances would not be unobscured.

original: rnam par chod par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par chod par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: But they are realized to be obscured.üîΩThat is not so.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: In that case,

original: de ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: de ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i /
translated: a single aspect of blue, etc.,

original: rnam pa gcig rtogs 'gyur zhing /üîΩdon gyi shes pa dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig myong ba gcig rtogs 'gyur gyi sngon po snang myong ba'i /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig rtogs 'gyur zhing / don gyi shes pa dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig myong ba gcig rtogs 'gyur gyi sngon po snang myong ba'i /
translated: would be realized,üîΩand the experience of the object-cognition alone, unmixed with that, would be realized.

original: sngon por snang ba'i myong ba'i myong ba de'i yul can don gyi shes par rnam par snang ba gzhan gyi myong ba so sor rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sngon por snang ba'i myong ba'i myong ba de'i yul can don gyi shes par rnam par snang ba gzhan gyi myong ba so sor rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: If the experience of the experience of the appearance of blue, the subject of the experience of the appearance of blue, is not realized separately as the appearance of the object-cognition,

original: gang gis na don shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis myong ba nyid du sgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na don shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis myong ba nyid du sgrub par 'gyur /
translated: then how could it be established that the object-cognition is experienced by another cognition?

original: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba nyid yin na yang gdon mi za bar ji skad du bshad pa'i snang ba dag gis myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba nyid yin na yang gdon mi za bar ji skad du bshad pa'i snang ba dag gis myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Even if it is experienced by another cognition, it must be experienced by the appearances as explained above.

original: cig car ram rim gyis don du snang bas sam /
analyzed: cig car ram rim gyis don du snang bas sam /
translated: because they appear as objects either simultaneously or successively,

original: de'i shes par snang ba yin pas na de dag ni yin no //
analyzed: de'i shes par snang ba yin pas na de dag ni yin no //
translated: or because they appear as the cognition of that.

original: rang rig pa la ni thal ba 'di yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa la ni thal ba 'di yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this reductio does not apply to reflexive awareness,

original: don gyi shes pa nyid ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa dang myong ba'i rnam pa gcig nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi shes pa nyid ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa dang myong ba'i rnam pa gcig nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the cognition of the object is produced in the nature of clarity, so the aspect of the object and the aspect of experience are identical.

original: de de ltar na re zhig bstan bcos mdzad pa rang nyid kyis grub pa la sgrub pa bstsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na re zhig bstan bcos mdzad pa rang nyid kyis grub pa la sgrub pa bstsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the author of the treatise has refuted the proof of what is already established.

original: da ni slob dpon gyis grub pa la sgrub pa gsal ba shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyis grub pa la sgrub pa gsal ba shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: Now, the master presents the text beginning with ‚ÄúThe cognition of another mind,‚Äù in order to clarify the proof of what is already established.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis rjes myong bar /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis rjes myong bar /
translated: The cognition of an object such as blue is not experienced by another cognition.

original: 'gyur @261b ba zhes bya ba de lta yin na yang shes pa'i shes pa la yang dran pa gang yin pa de mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur @261b ba zhes bya ba de lta yin na yang shes pa'i shes pa la yang dran pa gang yin pa de mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if that were the case, the memory of the cognition of cognition would not occur.

original: de rang nyid nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rang nyid nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not experience itself.

original: 'di ltar shes pa gang gis shes pa nyams su myong ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de la yang shes pa la dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa gang gis shes pa nyams su myong ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de la yang shes pa la dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ste /
translated: In the case of the cognition that is accepted as the experience of cognition, memory arises in relation to that cognition,

original: dper na nga'i shes pa shes par 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nga'i shes pa shes par 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: as in the case of the thought ‚ÄúI cognized the cognition.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba ma yin pa dran pa ma yin no //üîΩgang gis de ni myong ba bzhin //üîΩgal te rang nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba ma yin par 'dod na gang gis shes pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba yin /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ma yin pa dran pa ma yin no // gang gis de ni myong ba bzhin // gal te rang nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba ma yin par 'dod na gang gis shes pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba yin /
translated: There is no memory of what is not experienced.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúIt is experienced by another,‚ÄùüîΩthen that experience of cognition would be experienced by another cognition.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúIt is experienced by itself,‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: then it would be untenable to say that it is not experienced by itself.

original: gal te gzhan gyis de yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis de yin na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is experienced by another,‚Äù

original: shes pa'i shes pa de yang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i shes pa de yang shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then that experience of cognition would be experienced by another cognition.

original: 'dir phyogs snga ma de la shes pa'i shes pa tha ma la yang dran pa mthong ba de ltar na shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba thug pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir phyogs snga ma de la shes pa'i shes pa tha ma la yang dran pa mthong ba de ltar na shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba thug pa med pa yin no //
translated: Here, the opponent says that the final cognition of cognition is remembered, and so on.üîΩThus, the experience of one cognition by another is endless.

original: de ltar na dran pa'i sgo nas kyang yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i skyon slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang yin pa de re zhig gzhan nas rnam pa gzhan du yul gzhan la 'pho ba med par bstan pa'i phyir shes rig ces bya ba la sogs pas
analyzed: de ltar na dran pa'i sgo nas kyang yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i skyon slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang yin pa de re zhig gzhan nas rnam pa gzhan du yul gzhan la 'pho ba med par bstan pa'i phyir shes rig ces bya ba la sogs pas
translated: In this way, the master has explained the fault that there is no transference to another object through memory. In order to demonstrate that this is not the case, he says, ‚ÄúIf cognition is not cognized by another cognition,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan la 'dri bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la 'dri bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He asks the opponent a question.üîΩWhen the cognition of an object arises, there is the cognition of that and the cognition of the cognition of that. In this way, the experience of cognition is a series.

original: don gyi shes pa la skyes pa na de'i shes pa dang yang de'i shes pa'i shes pa ltar na brgyud pas yin pa de ltar na shes pa'i nyams su myong ba rnams kyis shes rig phreng ba gang yin pa 'di'i na shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i phrengüîΩba'i rjes su 'jug can /
analyzed: don gyi shes pa la skyes pa na de'i shes pa dang yang de'i shes pa'i shes pa ltar na brgyud pas yin pa de ltar na shes pa'i nyams su myong ba rnams kyis shes rig phreng ba gang yin pa 'di'i na shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i phrengüîΩba'i rjes su 'jug can /
translated: The experience of cognition is a series that follows.

original: rgyun chad pa med par 'di bya ba gzhan med pa can gang gis skyed /
analyzed: rgyun chad pa med par 'di bya ba gzhan med pa can gang gis skyed /
translated: What is it that generates it, since it is uninterrupted and does not have another action?

original: re zhig don ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig don ma yin te /
translated: How could it be produced by something that is not interrupted and does not have another activity?üîΩFirst, it is not the object of the fundamental consciousness,

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the visual consciousness.

original: snang ba'am dbang po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'am dbang po yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not light or the sense faculty,

original: don gyi shes pa la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi shes pa la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied to the object consciousness.

original: rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not without a cause,

original: thams cad la thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced at all times and in all ways by itself.

original: 'di'i skye ba de gang las yin brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skye ba de gang las yin brjod par bya'o //
translated: We must say from what its production comes.

original: de ltar na ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te de nyid snga blos yin blo snga ma gang yin pas rang nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i blo phyi ma phyi ma de nyid skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid snga blos yin blo snga ma gang yin pas rang nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i blo phyi ma phyi ma de nyid skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: if the later consciousness is produced from the earlier consciousness, then the earlier consciousness would be the cause of the later consciousness.

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩyul gzhan @262a * //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe / yul gzhan @262a * //
translated: If that is so,

original: la ni 'pho mi 'gyur //
analyzed: la ni 'pho mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not move to another object.

original: don gcig gi yul can gyi shes pa gzhan dang gzhan ni 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du 'jug pa de ltar na /
analyzed: don gcig gi yul can gyi shes pa gzhan dang gzhan ni 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du 'jug pa de ltar na /
translated: Other consciousnesses that have the same object as that consciousness would continue to operate for as long as cyclic existence continues.

original: yul gzhan la shes pa cung zad kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la shes pa cung zad kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, consciousness would not engage any other object at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzung ba skyed byed las gzhan min //üîΩ'on kyang de ltar skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nye ba ste nye ba nyid skyed byed yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'das ma thag pa ston par byed pas /
analyzed: gzung ba skyed byed las gzhan min // 'on kyang de ltar skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // des na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nye ba ste nye ba nyid skyed byed yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'das ma thag pa ston par byed pas /
translated: The object is not different from that which produces it.üîΩHowever, since it is produced in that way, it is characterized as an object.üîΩThus, this statement ‚ÄúThe object is characterized as an object because it is produced by that which is proximate‚Äù indicates that the immediately preceding condition is the cause of the object.

original: rgyu gcig la gnas pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu gcig la gnas pa nyid bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is said that the object is produced by the immediately preceding condition.

original: de de ltar na nye bar len pa'i ngo bor skyed par byed pa'i blo de dag gzung ba med par shes pa phyi mas ji ltar gzhan ni yul gzhan 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar na nye bar len pa'i ngo bor skyed par byed pa'i blo de dag gzung ba med par shes pa phyi mas ji ltar gzhan ni yul gzhan 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, how could the subsequent consciousness apprehend another object, since the consciousness that produces the object in that way does not exist?

original: blo snga ma de nyid thag nye ba blo phyi mas 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes brgyud pas yul gzhan la 'pho bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo snga ma de nyid thag nye ba blo phyi mas 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes brgyud pas yul gzhan la 'pho bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The later cognition apprehends the object that is the referent of the former cognition.

original: de ltar na blo snga ma de bdag la shes pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin la nges par gnas pa /
analyzed: de ltar na blo snga ma de bdag la shes pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin la nges par gnas pa /
translated: Thus, the former cognition definitely remains in its nature of generating consciousness of itself.

original: bdag nyid shes pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i blo nang yan lag rang 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa skyed pa la nang gi yan lag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid shes pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i blo nang yan lag rang 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa skyed pa la nang gi yan lag tu gyur pa /
translated: The cognition that remains in the nature of generating consciousness of itself is an internal part that generates the consciousness that apprehends itself.

original: de bdag la phyi yan lag gzhan gang gis te /
analyzed: de bdag la phyi yan lag gzhan gang gis te /
translated: What external part obstructs it?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig gis gags ni byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig gis gags ni byed par 'gyur /
translated: What external object such as form obstructs it?

original: gang gis ni de ma gtogs par shes pa phyi mas yul 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis ni de ma gtogs par shes pa phyi mas yul 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: By what other later cognition would the object be apprehended if it were not obstructed?

original: de ltar na yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa nyid kyis gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa nyid kyis gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the thesis that it does not transfer to other objects is established.

original: phyi rol don nyi nye bas kyang de la gags byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol don nyi nye bas kyang de la gags byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that external objects obstruct it because of their proximity.

original: nang gi yan lag tu gyur pa'i blo de la phyi rol gyi don nye ba la yang gags byed nus pa med nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nang gi yan lag tu gyur pa'i blo de la phyi rol gyi don nye ba la yang gags byed nus pa med nus pa ma yin te /
translated: As for the internal factor, the cognition, it is not capable of obstructing the presence of external objects,

original: phyi ma'i yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: phyi ma'i yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: because it is a later factor.üîΩMoreover, when the presence of external objects obstructs the cognition,

original: gzhan yang phyi rol don nye bas kyang de la blo de 'dra ba gags byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol don nye bas kyang de la blo de 'dra ba gags byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: gzhan du don ni nye ba na /
analyzed: gzhan du don ni nye ba na /
translated: when the object is present,

original: nye bar gyur pa na skyes bu 'gas bdag blo myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa na skyes bu 'gas bdag blo myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: no person would ever experience the cognition.

original: de ltar na don blo dang blo gcig gis nyams su myong ba 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na don blo dang blo gcig gis nyams su myong ba 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the experience of the object and the cognition by a single cognition is refuted.

original: gang gi tshe blo'i don gags byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo'i don gags byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the cognition obstructs the object,

original: srid par rgyu ba can lnga la don nye ba can gnas skabs 'ga'/
analyzed: srid par rgyu ba can lnga la don nye ba can gnas skabs 'ga'/
translated: at that time, for the five who wander in existence,üîΩthe presence of the object is not possible in any situation,

original: yod min / gang gis na 'ga' zhig gi tshe @262b gags byed pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gis blo nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yod min / gang gis na 'ga' zhig gi tshe @262b gags byed pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gis blo nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: by what would the cognition be experienced by some at some time, because there is no obstruction?

original: de'i phyir blo 'ga' zhig kyang nyams su myong ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo 'ga' zhig kyang nyams su myong ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there is no cause for the experience of any cognition,

original: blo'i dran pa can yang rtsa nas bton pa dang / rgyu mtshan med par gyur pa'i //
analyzed: blo'i dran pa can yang rtsa nas bton pa dang / rgyu mtshan med par gyur pa'i //
translated: the memory of that cognition is also completely eliminated, and there is no reason for it.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni nyams su myong ba 'ga' zhig ma yin gyi blo de'i dran pa yang rgyun chad pa ste med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni nyams su myong ba 'ga' zhig ma yin gyi blo de'i dran pa yang rgyun chad pa ste med pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only is there no experience of any cognition, but also the memory of that cognition is interrupted and does not exist.

original: de ltar 'dod pa mdzes zhes bya ba ni dpyas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa mdzes zhes bya ba ni dpyas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is beautiful to assert this.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de dag la don nye ba na yod pa la gags byed pa yod pa'i phyir yul gzhan la 'pho ba ni bla ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de dag la don nye ba na yod pa la gags byed pa yod pa'i phyir yul gzhan la 'pho ba ni bla ste /
translated: It is possible that the consciousnesses such as eye consciousness that exist when an object is present are transferred to another object because there is an obstruction.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam rtog rnams /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam rtog rnams /
translated: But the conceptual consciousnesses of past objects, etc.,

original: 'bad rtsol las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can /
translated: are of a kind that arises from effort.

original: gang la phyi rol gyi don la reg pa med pa'am /
analyzed: gang la phyi rol gyi don la reg pa med pa'am /
translated: They do not contact external objects or

original: nye ba la ltos pa med pa rnams la don ni nye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: nye ba la ltos pa med pa rnams la don ni nye ba med pa ste /
translated: depend on the presence of an object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin pa de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin pa de /
translated: The conceptual consciousnesses that are a continuum

original: skyed pa la gags byed pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'pho bar byed pa'i don med pa'i phyir shes pa 'dzin pa las gzhan du 'pho ba'i rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed pa la gags byed pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'pho bar byed pa'i don med pa'i phyir shes pa 'dzin pa las gzhan du 'pho ba'i rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no cause for the transference of consciousness, it is illogical to say that consciousness is transferred to another life.

original: 'pho ba'i rgyu ni med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i rgyu ni med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no cause for transference,üîΩthe continuum of consciousness is a series of consciousnesses that are momentary conceptual thoughts.

original: rtag tu rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin pa de ltar na don gzhan zhig la rnam par rtog pa dpyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don la dpyod ba rgyun chad 'gyur te don la dpyod pa zhes bya ba cung zadüîΩkyang yod do zhes bya ba'i gtam der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin pa de ltar na don gzhan zhig la rnam par rtog pa dpyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don la dpyod ba rgyun chad 'gyur te don la dpyod pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i gtam der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the analysis of the object would be interrupted, and it would be meaningless to say that the analysis of the object is a little bit existent.üîΩIf the consciousness that is produced by the object were to be destroyed, then the consciousness that is produced by the object would not be produced.

original: gal te shes pa skyed par byed pa tha mar bdag la ste bdag gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rim gyis zad par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te shes pa skyed par byed pa tha mar bdag la ste bdag gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rim gyis zad par 'gyur bas /
translated: If the consciousness that is produced by the object were to be destroyed, then the consciousness that is produced by the object would not be produced.

original: 'di'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa zad par 'gyur bas rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa zad par 'gyur bas rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the potency that generates consciousness in this case has been exhausted, it does not generate consciousness of its object.

original: de ltar na shes pa yul gzhan la ni 'pho ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa yul gzhan la ni 'pho ba yin na /
translated: Thus, if consciousness is transferred to another object,

original: yul 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yul 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: at the time of desiring the object,

original: sngon blo'i nus pa zad yin na //
analyzed: sngon blo'i nus pa zad yin na //
translated: the potency of the prior cognition is exhausted.

original: gang las don blo de'i de nyid yin /
analyzed: gang las don blo de'i de nyid yin /
translated: That is the nature of the cognition of the object.

original: yul gcig las skyed pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin na /
analyzed: yul gcig las skyed pa'i shes pa brgyud pa yin na /
translated: If the continuum of consciousness is generated from a single object,

original: shes pa tha ma'i nus pa zad pa'i phyir yul gzhan la don mthong ba na nye bar len pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na mi skye ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa tha ma'i nus pa zad pa'i phyir yul gzhan la don mthong ba na nye bar len pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na mi skye ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because the potency of the final consciousness is exhausted, when the object is seen in another object, there is not the slightest cause for appropriating it. Thus, it is said that it does not arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: @263a * // sngon blo med par blo ma yin //
analyzed: @263a * // sngon blo med par blo ma yin //
translated: without a prior cognition, there is no cognition.

original: blo snga ma nus pa can med pa blo phyi ma 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo snga ma nus pa can med pa blo phyi ma 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without a prior cognition that possesses potency, a subsequent cognition does not arise.

original: rang nyid kyang gang las shes /
analyzed: rang nyid kyang gang las shes /
translated: How is it known that it is so?

original: gzhan la chags pas nus bral ba'i //
analyzed: gzhan la chags pas nus bral ba'i //
translated: Because of attachment to others, it is devoid of potency.

original: shes pa yul gzhan la sogs pas shes pa snga ma nus pa med par byas par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: shes pa yul gzhan la sogs pas shes pa snga ma nus pa med par byas par gyur pa yin na /
translated: If consciousness is made devoid of potency by another object, etc.,

original: shes pa skye ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa skye ba med phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness does not arise.

original: rang gi yul nye ba na yod pa na yang shes pa skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul nye ba na yod pa na yang shes pa skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when its own object is present, consciousness is not observed to arise.

original: shes pa phyi ma shes pa snga ma la ltos pa snga na nus pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la ltos pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma shes pa snga ma la ltos pa snga na nus pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la ltos pa med pa yin na /
translated: If the later consciousness is dependent on the earlier consciousness, and the earlier one is devoid of potency, then without dependence,

original: phyi ma ltos pa med par skye ba can de ci'i phyir nye bar mi 'gyur de de ltar na shes pa snga ma'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi ma ltos pa med par skye ba can de ci'i phyir nye bar mi 'gyur de de ltar na shes pa snga ma'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
translated: why wouldn't the later one arise without dependence? In that case, because it conforms to the earlier consciousness,

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
translated: it would be its effect.

original: gal te de ltar na rnam par shes pa snga ma rnam par chags pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rnam par shes pa snga ma rnam par chags pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, because the earlier consciousness conforms to attachment, distraction, etc.,

original: phyi ma'i de nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i rgyu las cig car 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yul gzhan la chags
analyzed: phyi ma'i de nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i rgyu las cig car 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yul gzhan la chags
translated: If the latter were the cause of appropriating the body, then the consciousness that arises simultaneously with the appropriating cause of the foundation consciousness would be the mental consciousness that is attached to another object.

original: pa'am chags pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'am chags pa med pa yin no //
translated: Or it would be the mental consciousness that is not attached to another object.

original: de ltar na de la chags pa yod na yod yul gzhan la shes pa 'jug par 'gyur na 'jug par yang mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na de la chags pa yod na yod yul gzhan la shes pa 'jug par 'gyur na 'jug par yang mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: If it were attached to another object, then the consciousness would engage another object, but it does not engage another object.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar le na pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar le na pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore the foundation consciousness is not the cause of appropriating the body.

original: 'on kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na yin te /
translated: However, the mental consciousness is the cause of appropriating the body.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it follows the mental consciousness and engages in the reverse order.

original: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The error does not exist in that way.

original: 'di ltar cig car rigs mi mthun skye na /
analyzed: 'di ltar cig car rigs mi mthun skye na /
translated: If consciousnesses of different type arise simultaneously,

original: cig car kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i rgyu las rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skye bar khas blangs pa na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa cig shos ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yod pa yin pa de
analyzed: cig car kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i rgyu las rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skye bar khas blangs pa na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa cig shos ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yod pa yin pa de
translated: When you accept that consciousnesses of different types arise from the appropriating cause, the foundation consciousness, then the foundation consciousness and the other consciousnesses exist as mutual causes and effects.

original: ltar na / shin tu gsal ba'i sems gcig gis yul gzhan la chags pa nus pa dang bral ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid de las gzhan pa'i shes pa skyed pa la nus pa med par byas pa yin /
analyzed: ltar na / shin tu gsal ba'i sems gcig gis yul gzhan la chags pa nus pa dang bral ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid de las gzhan pa'i shes pa skyed pa la nus pa med par byas pa yin /
translated: In that case, a very clear consciousness would be devoid of the capacity to engage an object, and the foundation consciousness would be devoid of the capacity to generate other consciousnesses.

original: de ltar na nus pa med par byas pa can kun gzhi las rnam par shes pa gzhan du 'byung ba med /
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa med par byas pa can kun gzhi las rnam par shes pa gzhan du 'byung ba med /
translated: In that case, consciousness would not arise from the foundation consciousness, which has been rendered devoid of capacity.

original: @263b yul gzhan du 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @263b yul gzhan du 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousnesses such as eye consciousness, which have the mode of apprehending objects, would not arise.

original: de de ltar na rnam par shes pa nus pa med pa ma yin pa snga ma ni phyi ma'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na rnam par shes pa nus pa med pa ma yin pa snga ma ni phyi ma'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the prior consciousness, which is not devoid of potentiality, is the cause of the subsequent consciousness.üîΩIf it were not the cause, then the subsequent consciousness would not occur when the prior consciousness occurs.

original: gal te rgyur mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe de ltar min na yid 'jug / shes pa snga ma 'jug pa gang yin pa de mtshungs pa ste nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgyur mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe de ltar min na yid 'jug / shes pa snga ma 'jug pa gang yin pa de mtshungs pa ste nus pa yin no //
translated: The prior consciousness is the potentiality of the subsequent consciousness.

original: yid gzhan la shes pa phyi ma skye ba la ltos mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid gzhan la shes pa phyi ma skye ba la ltos mi 'gyur /
translated: The subsequent consciousness would not depend on the prior consciousness.

original: gzhan la chags pa la sogs pas nus pa med pa yin na yang nus pa med pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la chags pa la sogs pas nus pa med pa yin na yang nus pa med pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the prior consciousness is devoid of potentiality due to attachment to other objects, it would not be devoid of potentiality.

original: sems nus pa yod pa la ltos pa de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du cig car yang 'byung bar 'gyur gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems nus pa yod pa la ltos pa de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du cig car yang 'byung bar 'gyur gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness arises in accordance with the conditions of visual consciousness, etc., and arises simultaneously, but not the mental consciousness.

original: 'on kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag ni rim bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag ni rim bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the mental consciousnesses arise in sequence.üîΩAnd that is so:

original: de yang / yid shes rim bzhin skye ba yang //
analyzed: de yang / yid shes rim bzhin skye ba yang //
translated: The mental consciousness arises in sequence.

original: ltos pas rab tu grub pa yin //
analyzed: ltos pas rab tu grub pa yin //
translated: It is well established through dependence.

original: shes pa snga ma snga mas nus pa med pa yin pa ltos pa med pa phyi ma phyi ma dag rim pa bzhin du skye bar bstan to //
analyzed: shes pa snga ma snga mas nus pa med pa yin pa ltos pa med pa phyi ma phyi ma dag rim pa bzhin du skye bar bstan to //
translated: The earlier cognitions are powerless, and the later ones arise in sequence without relying on anything else.

original: de ltar na shes pa ni gcig nyid kyir rgyur 'gyur ba de lta na yang shes pa re re bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa ni gcig nyid kyir rgyur 'gyur ba de lta na yang shes pa re re bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though a single cognition serves as the cause of a single cognition, the cognitions arise one by one.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te shes pa skyed par byed pa'i blo snga ma snga ma re re ltos pa med par phyi ma phyi ma skye bar 'gyur na re re skyed pa'i so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te shes pa skyed par byed pa'i blo snga ma snga ma re re ltos pa med par phyi ma phyi ma skye bar 'gyur na re re skyed pa'i so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the earlier cognitions that produce cognitions were to arise later without relying on anything else, they would not be individually determined to produce each one.

original: de'i tshe cig car rnam par rtog pa'i blo thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin pa de'i phyir blo gcig snga ma snga ma so sor nges pa las blo gcig po phyi ma skye bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe cig car rnam par rtog pa'i blo thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin pa de'i phyir blo gcig snga ma snga ma so sor nges pa las blo gcig po phyi ma skye bar nges pa yin no //
translated: At that time, all conceptual cognitions would arise simultaneously, but that is not the case. Therefore, it is certain that each later cognition arises individually from each earlier cognition.

original: gang gi tshe yid gcig po rtag pa rdul phran yin par sems pa gang yin pa de'i gal te yid ni de gcig nyid phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yid gcig po rtag pa rdul phran yin par sems pa gang yin pa de'i gal te yid ni de gcig nyid phyir /
translated: When the mind is thought to be permanent and atomic, if the mind is one,

original: rgyu'i phyir de las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir de las gzhan pa ste /
translated: then it is not related to other sense faculties because of being a cause.

original: dbang po las 'brel par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: dbang po las 'brel par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: At that time,

original: dbang po gzhan la mi rten par de'i phyir blo re re skye bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan la mi rten par de'i phyir blo re re skye bar nges pa yin no //
translated: because it does not rely on other sense faculties, it is certain that each cognition arises.

original: gal te de ltar na gzhan dbang po gcig la chags pa yid gzhan mi rten dbang po'i khyad par gzhan la mi rten pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gzhan dbang po gcig la chags pa yid gzhan mi rten dbang po'i khyad par gzhan la mi rten pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, because it does not rely on other sense faculties, it does not rely on other sense faculties that are attached to one sense faculty.

original: cig car shes pa gzhan mi skye //
analyzed: cig car shes pa gzhan mi skye //
translated: Because of that, other cognitions do not arise simultaneously.

original: khas len pas blo gcig po snga ma'i nus pa so sor nges pa las ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khas len pas blo gcig po snga ma'i nus pa so sor nges pa las ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since it is accepted that the previous cognition does not arise from the specific potency of the mind,

original: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not logical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: @264a * // la lar cig car 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: @264a * // la lar cig car 'byung phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises simultaneously in some.

original: la lar ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yul nye ba na cig car mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skye ba mthong phyir snga ma yang rab tu bsgrubs zin pa yin no //üîΩ'dis kyang 'jug pa mtshungs na /
analyzed: la lar ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yul nye ba na cig car mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skye ba mthong phyir snga ma yang rab tu bsgrubs zin pa yin no // 'dis kyang 'jug pa mtshungs na /
translated: This also shows that the eye consciousness arises simultaneously with the movement.üîΩIf the eye consciousness arises simultaneously with the movement,

original: mtshungs nyid phyir /
analyzed: mtshungs nyid phyir /
translated: then the eye consciousness and the movement are the same in being simultaneous.

original: gang gi tshe yul shin tu gsal ba ma yin pa thag nye ba na yod pa de'i sgo nas sam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul shin tu gsal ba ma yin pa thag nye ba na yod pa de'i sgo nas sam /
translated: If the object is not very clear, then the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the movement.

original: skyes bu bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul gzhan mthong bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: skyes bu bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul gzhan mthong bar mi 'dod na /
translated: If the person does not wish to see another object,

original: gang gis na de kun nas slong ba'i 'bad rtsol las dbang po gzhan la yid rten par 'gyur /üîΩde de ltar na skyes bu dang yul dag la mtshungs pa yod na dbang po gcig la mtshungs pa ste /üîΩbye brag med par 'jug pa de'i tshe mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir gnas skabs 'di nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis na de kun nas slong ba'i 'bad rtsol las dbang po gzhan la yid rten par 'gyur / de de ltar na skyes bu dang yul dag la mtshungs pa yod na dbang po gcig la mtshungs pa ste / bye brag med par 'jug pa de'i tshe mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir gnas skabs 'di nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then why would the mind rely on another sense faculty, such as the ear, in order to motivate the movement?üîΩIf the person and the object are the same in that they are simultaneous, and the sense faculty is the same in that it engages without distinction, then at that time, they are the same in being simultaneous.

original: thams cad ni gzhan /
analyzed: thams cad ni gzhan /
translated: In that case, all the sense faculties would be the same in being simultaneous.

original: yul gzhan mi rtogs mi dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yul gzhan mi rtogs mi dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the other sense faculties do not cognize or observe other objects,üîΩthen the eye consciousness would not be the same in being simultaneous with the movement.

original: dmigs par yang 'gyur ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par yang 'gyur ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams la yid 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ltos pa ma yin pa de ltar 'bras bu de dag cig car nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩgang la yid dbang po dang 'brel par gyur pa de la dbang po gzhan la brten pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams la yid 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ltos pa ma yin pa de ltar 'bras bu de dag cig car nyid du 'gyur ro // gang la yid dbang po dang 'brel par gyur pa de la dbang po gzhan la brten pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The consciousnesses would be simultaneous, because the mental faculty is not dependent on any other faculty at any time.üîΩWhen the mental faculty is related to the sense faculty, the eye consciousness and so on arise in sequence, because it is not dependent on another faculty.

original: des byas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du skye bar rtogs par 'gyur ba gang gi tshe bdag dang lhan cig 'ba' zhig 'brel par 'gyur pa de'i tshe bdag nyid dang ni ldan tsam las /
analyzed: des byas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du skye bar rtogs par 'gyur ba gang gi tshe bdag dang lhan cig 'ba' zhig 'brel par 'gyur pa de'i tshe bdag nyid dang ni ldan tsam las /
translated: When it is related to the self alone, then at that time, the self is related to the mental faculty alone, and the mental faculty is related to the self alone.

original: skyes rnams cig car skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes rnams cig car skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The consciousnesses that arise would be simultaneous.

original: bdag dang yid ldan pa tsam las 'byung ba dang ngang tshul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni cig car skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang yid ldan pa tsam las 'byung ba dang ngang tshul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni cig car skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: All those consciousnesses that arise from the mere relationship of the self and the mental faculty, and that are of the nature of arising, would be simultaneous.

original: de la yid kyi go rims kyi rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yid kyi go rims kyi rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is no reason to suppose that the order of the mental factors is due to the order of their causes.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgcig las bya ba gcig yin na'ang //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gcig las bya ba gcig yin na'ang //
translated: ‚ÄîThis is true, butüîΩeven if there is only one action,

original: byed pa gcig nyid kyis bya ba gcig nyid byed do //
analyzed: byed pa gcig nyid kyis bya ba gcig nyid byed do //
translated: the one agent performs the one action by means of the one instrument.

original: yid kyang byed pa gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: yid kyang byed pa gcig nyid yin te /
translated: And the mind is the one instrument.

original: blo'i ngo bo'i bya ba gcig nyid byed kyi gcig bdag dang yid dang ldan pa tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi blo rnams skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo'i ngo bo'i bya ba gcig nyid byed kyi gcig bdag dang yid dang ldan pa tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi blo rnams skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The one action of the mind is the one action of the one agent, and the mind is not the source of the arising of the minds that have the nature of being the self of the one agent and the mind.üîΩIf you accept that the one action is the action of the one agent because of the one instrument, then

original: gal te byed pa gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir des rnam par nges par bya ba yang gcig nyid yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te byed pa gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir des rnam par nges par bya ba yang gcig nyid yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: the one action would be the action of the many agents.

original: cig car mar me du mas mthong //
analyzed: cig car mar me du mas mthong //
translated: If the one action is the action of the many agents because of the one instrument, then the many agents would see the one object, just as the many lamps illuminate the one object.

original: ci'i phyir skyes bu @264b du mas mthong ba du ma sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa bstan to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyes bu @264b du mas mthong ba du ma sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa bstan to //
translated: Why is it that the many agents are said to accomplish the one action?

original: ci ste yang lta ba po du ma'i dbang gis mar me'i shes pa du ma sgrub par byed par 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang lta ba po du ma'i dbang gis mar me'i shes pa du ma sgrub par byed par 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that the many cognitions of the lamp are established by the many viewers,

original: 'o na ni yid nges par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni yid nges par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: then the mind is not the determiner.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa rnams bdag nyid bag chags yongs su smin pa'i khyad par can gyi ngo bo nges par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa rnams bdag nyid bag chags yongs su smin pa'i khyad par can gyi ngo bo nges par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Rather, the cognitions themselves, which are the special nature of the maturation of their own habitual tendencies, are the determiners.

original: de ltar cig car rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar cig car rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pas na /
translated: Since they do not generate cognitions simultaneously,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar na 'brel ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar na 'brel ba med pa yin no //
translated: they are not to be inferred, and thus they are not related.

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe yid shes pa phyi ma skyed par mi byed pa de'i tshe ci ste skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe yid shes pa phyi ma skyed par mi byed pa de'i tshe ci ste skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /
translated: But when the subsequent mental cognition does not generate a subsequent cognition, why does it not generate it? Is it because it is by nature unable to generate it?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or is it not?

original: gal te skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin na de'i rang bzhin tsam las byung ba'i ngang tshul cig car 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin na de'i rang bzhin tsam las byung ba'i ngang tshul cig car 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is by nature able to generate it, then it would generate it just by its nature.

original: ci ste skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa de'i tshe rim gyis kyang rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nus med 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa de'i tshe rim gyis kyang rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nus med 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does not have the nature of a producer, then it would be powerless to gradually produce consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phyis kyang bye brag med phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang bye brag med phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no difference later.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sngar byed pa po'i rang bzhin ma yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sngar byed pa po'i rang bzhin ma yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not be different from what it was previously, when it did not have the nature of a producer.

original: bshad ma thag pa des lus skyes bu bshad pa yin /üîΩlus las blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes sems gang yin de'i gal te lus gcig po de sngar skyed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa des lus skyes bu bshad pa yin / lus las blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes sems gang yin de'i gal te lus gcig po de sngar skyed pa ma yin na /
translated: By this just explained, the body is explained as the person.üîΩIf that very body that was not previously produced by the mind were not produced later,

original: phyis kyang skyed par byed par mi 'gyur bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang skyed par byed par mi 'gyur bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the mind would not be the producer of the body, because there would be no difference.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu yang zhes bya bas lan bstan zin to //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu yang zhes bya bas lan bstan zin to //
translated: In the same way, the person would not be the experiencer of the body.

original: gal te 'du byed las nges yin shes las skyes pa'i rgyu 'du byed pa de las blo re res so sor nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed las nges yin shes las skyes pa'i rgyu 'du byed pa de las blo re res so sor nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the mind is definitely produced from the body, then the mind would be produced from each of the individual causes that produce the body.

original: de ni 'di ltar yang 'du byed de dag bdag nyid la gnas pa yod na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa thams cad cig car 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar yang 'du byed de dag bdag nyid la gnas pa yod na 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa thams cad cig car 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to endure by themselves, then all cognitions that have the nature of arising would occur simultaneously.

original: ci ste yang byed nye ba yin na de'i tshe 'du byed gang yin pa de phyis gang las 'ongs pa yin zhing de'i tshe skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste yang byed nye ba yin na de'i tshe 'du byed gang yin pa de phyis gang las 'ongs pa yin zhing de'i tshe skyed par 'gyur /
translated: But if they are produced by something else, then what is that something else that later arises from the formations?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te blo yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te blo yin na /
translated: If you say that it is cognition,

original: blo las 'du byed yin zhing de las blo 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo las 'du byed yin zhing de las blo 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then formations are produced by cognition and cognition is produced by formations.

original: 'dod par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: 'dod par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: We agree with that.

original: blo'i bag chags kyi bye brag kho bo cag 'du byed nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: blo'i bag chags kyi bye brag kho bo cag 'du byed nyid du 'dod do //
translated: We assert that the specific latent impressions of cognition are formations.

original: de las blo skye ba'i phyir blo las skye bar 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las blo skye ba'i phyir blo las skye bar 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since cognition arises from that, we agree that it is produced by cognition.

original: de bas na de @265a * //
analyzed: de bas na de @265a * //
translated: Therefore,üîΩwe agree with whatever is explained in that way.

original: skad du bshad pa gang yin pa de 'dod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na blo sngon med par blo ma yin zhes bya ba de grub pa yin na /
analyzed: skad du bshad pa gang yin pa de 'dod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na blo sngon med par blo ma yin zhes bya ba de grub pa yin na /
translated: If that is so, then it is established that cognition does not arise from noncognition.

original: blo snga ma ni blo phyi ma skyed par byed pa med pa la nye bar len pa'i ngo bor yod pa yin no //
analyzed: blo snga ma ni blo phyi ma skyed par byed pa med pa la nye bar len pa'i ngo bor yod pa yin no //
translated: The former cognition exists as the nature of the appropriator of the latter cognition that is being generated.

original: de bas na blo ni blo skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyams pa ma yin pa de ltar na blo snga ma cig shos kyis gzung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na blo ni blo skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyams pa ma yin pa de ltar na blo snga ma cig shos kyis gzung ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the former cognition is not devoid of the capacity to generate the latter cognition, and thus the former cognition is apprehended by the latter.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: nye bar len pa'i ngo bo tsam yin pa ni bla ste gzhan gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i ngo bo tsam yin pa ni bla ste gzhan gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is fine that it is merely the nature of the appropriator, but it does not become the object of the other.

original: de la / gzung ba skyed byed las gzhan min //
analyzed: de la / gzung ba skyed byed las gzhan min //
translated: In response to that, Aryadeva says: The object is not different from that which generates the object.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po zin pa'i mtshan nyid skyed par byed pa nyid gzung ba nyid yin nom //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po zin pa'i mtshan nyid skyed par byed pa nyid gzung ba nyid yin nom //
translated: That which generates the object that has the character of being grasped is the object itself.

original: rnam par shes par skyed byed gzung mtshan nyid min te /üîΩsnang ba gzung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes par skyed byed gzung mtshan nyid min te / snang ba gzung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Consciousness is not the object because it generates consciousness.üîΩIf it is argued that the appearance is not the object,

original: gal te gzung ba skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not that it does not generate the object.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid skyed par 'gyur ba gzung ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid skyed par 'gyur ba gzung ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the characteristic of the object, it would be the object itself.

original: cha med can la yang phra sogs med //
analyzed: cha med can la yang phra sogs med //
translated: Even if it is partless, it has no parts such as subtle.

original: snang ba'i yan lag phra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par chod pa'i phyir dang / thag ring po na gnas pa'i phyir shin tu nye ba'i phyir dang / yan lag khyad par bye brag can phra ba'i gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid ni cha med can la yang phra sogs med /
analyzed: snang ba'i yan lag phra ba la sogs pa'i rnam par chod pa'i phyir dang / thag ring po na gnas pa'i phyir shin tu nye ba'i phyir dang / yan lag khyad par bye brag can phra ba'i gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid ni cha med can la yang phra sogs med /
translated: Because the parts of the appearance are cut off as subtle and so on, because it is distant, because it is very close, and because it is not the object of subtle parts that have specific features, even if it is partless, it has no parts such as subtle.

original: 'dzin pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ring por gnas pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yan lag med pa la phra ba la sogs pa med pa de ltar na gang las gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ring por gnas pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yan lag med pa la phra ba la sogs pa med pa de ltar na gang las gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin /
translated: Because it is the nature of the appropriator of the apprehender, it does not endure for a long time, and because it is the nature of consciousness that possesses no parts, subtle and so on do not exist. In that case, from what is it not the characteristic of the object?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so.

original: gzung ba'i nus pa nyams 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: gzung ba'i nus pa nyams 'gyur gyi //
translated: The capacity of the object would be impaired.

original: 'di bskyed bdag nyid gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: 'di bskyed bdag nyid gzhan ma yin //
translated: It is not produced by another nature.

original: shes pa de'i nus pa ni gnyis yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de'i nus pa ni gnyis yin te /
translated: The potency of that consciousness is twofold:

original: gzung ba nyid kyi nus pa dang / shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid kyi nus pa dang / shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: the potency of the object and the potency that generates consciousness.

original: de bas na shes pa'i gzung ba'i nus pa nyams pa yin gyi gzhan skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid nye bar len pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas skyed par byed pa nyid nyams pa yin na /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa'i gzung ba'i nus pa nyams pa yin gyi gzhan skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid nye bar len pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas skyed par byed pa nyid nyams pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the potency of consciousness as object declines, but the potency that generates consciousness does not decline,

original: des na nye bar len pa'i ngo bo yin na yang shes pa'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bas na yul gzhan la 'pho ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa'i ngo bo yin na yang shes pa'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bas na yul gzhan la 'pho ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then even though it is the nature of the object to generate consciousness, it is not the characteristic of consciousness as object. Therefore, it is said that the object is transferred to another.üîΩIf that were so, if the aspect that is the characteristic of the object were generated in any way, then it would be different from the object.üîΩIf it is the same as the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is different from the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is the same as the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i rnam pa ji ltar yang skyed par byad pa gang yin pa de gzung @265b ba nyid las gzhan du 'gyur na ji ltar bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa gang gis gzugsüîΩshes pa la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i rnam pa ji ltar yang skyed par byad pa gang yin pa de gzung @265b ba nyid las gzhan du 'gyur na ji ltar bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa gang gis gzugsüîΩshes pa la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If it is different from the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is the same as the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is different from the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is the same as the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is different from the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is the same as the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is different from the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is the same as the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is different from the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is the same as the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?üîΩIf it is different from the object, how could it be the object of apprehension?

original: gzung ba nyid la skyed byed ni //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid la skyed byed ni //
translated: If it is not the producer of the object,

original: gzhan min des na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa skyed par byed pa'i blo gzung ba nyid du skyed par byed do ma yin na skyed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan min des na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa skyed par byed pa'i blo gzung ba nyid du skyed par byed do ma yin na skyed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the cognition that produces the object, because it is not the producer of the object.

original: de lta min na /
analyzed: de lta min na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: then form and so on would not be the producer of the object.

original: gal te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du skyed par mi byed pa de'i tshe brgyud pas phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du skyed par mi byed pa de'i tshe brgyud pas phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not produce the object, then it does not indirectly benefit it.

original: dngos su mig la sogs pa'i blo la /
analyzed: dngos su mig la sogs pa'i blo la /
translated: The cognition of the eye and so on

original: gzugs sogs phan 'dogs byed ma yin //
analyzed: gzugs sogs phan 'dogs byed ma yin //
translated: does not benefit form and so on.

original: gzung ba'i ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i ma yin no //
translated: It does not benefit the object.

original: de bas na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid las yul la sogs pa bskal pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid las yul la sogs pa bskal pa ma yin pa /
translated: Therefore, the object and so on are not separate from the cognition that produces the object.

original: las 'di'i gzugs la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: las 'di'i gzugs la sogs pa'i /
translated: This form and so on

original: de dngos nges par gzhan ci yin //
analyzed: de dngos nges par gzhan ci yin //
translated: is definitely not different from that.

original: gzung ba nyid du nges pa yin na yang gang gis na de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid du nges pa yin na yang gang gis na de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is ascertained as the object, then how could the consciousness that has it as its object not arise?

original: blo la'ang blo phyi ma skyed pa la dngos su phan 'dogs pa yin pa nyid /
analyzed: blo la'ang blo phyi ma skyed pa la dngos su phan 'dogs pa yin pa nyid /
translated: The later cognition is directly beneficial for the arising of the later cognition.

original: de yod de ltar na de tsam gyi blo de yang de nyid gzung ba nyid du nges par rnam par gnas pa gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yul gyis bskal pa la sogs pa med pa dang mig la sogs pa nye ba na yod pa'i gzung ba'i mtshanüîΩnyid gzhan ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod de ltar na de tsam gyi blo de yang de nyid gzung ba nyid du nges par rnam par gnas pa gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yul gyis bskal pa la sogs pa med pa dang mig la sogs pa nye ba na yod pa'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan ltos par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it exists, then that cognition is ascertained as the object, just like form and so on. It is not separate from the object, and it is not dependent on other characteristics of the object, such as being near the eye faculty and so on.

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yul na mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mig la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yul na mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mig la sogs pa nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not a physical object and it does not exist in a place, and because it is connected to the eye faculty and so on.

original: 'on kyang sems de nyid ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems de nyid ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: However, that mind itself is the characteristic of the object.

original: 'di lta ste 'dzin pa'i nye bar len dang myong ba de tsam nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dzin pa'i nye bar len dang myong ba de tsam nyid yin no //
translated: It is simply the experience of the appropriation of the apprehender.

original: ngar 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa dang blo'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de gnyis so //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa dang blo'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de gnyis so //
translated: The two are the appropriator of the consciousness that grasps the ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the nature of the mind.

original: de ltar na blo shes bya'i gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na blo shes bya'i gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the mind is not the object of cognition,

original: gzhan gyi shes pa yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi shes pa yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the consciousness of another would also have the character of an object.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the nature of the cause of appropriation alone,

original: dbang po yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sense organ would also have the character of an object.

original: de bas na de gnyis 'khrul pa ma yin no //üîΩde yang blo'i bdag nyid @266a * //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis 'khrul pa ma yin no // de yang blo'i bdag nyid @266a * //
translated: Therefore, neither of these two is mistaken.

original: du yod pa yin pa de ltar na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //üîΩde ltar ma yin na de blo gzhan gyis 'dzin na /
analyzed: du yod pa yin pa de ltar na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no // de ltar ma yin na de blo gzhan gyis 'dzin na /
translated: Moreover, it exists in the nature of the mind, and thus it has the character of an object.üîΩIf it were not so, and if it were apprehended by another mind,

original: gzhan gyi sems ci'i phyir nyams su mi myong zhes 'dri bar byed ba la gdon mi za bar byed pa gzhan gyi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ci'i phyir nyams su mi myong zhes 'dri bar byed ba la gdon mi za bar byed pa gzhan gyi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: why would one not experience the mind of another? It must be the case that it is the other‚Äôs own mind.

original: de'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: because it is not the entity that appropriates the self, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi nyid yin pa de yang rnam par dpyad na 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i nye bar len pa ma yin pa nyid du gnas pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyid yin pa de yang rnam par dpyad na 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i nye bar len pa ma yin pa nyid du gnas pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: And that which is other is not the object of the cognition that apprehends it, for it is not the object of the cognition that appropriates it.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyi chos la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyi chos la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the self because it is the property of the self,

original: bdag nyid kyang nye bar len pa nyid du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang nye bar len pa nyid du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: then the self is included in the appropriated aggregates.

original: de bas na 'di gzung ba nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gzung ba nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is definitely the object of apprehension.

original: gal te phra ba la sogs pa yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang nye bar len par gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems kyang ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te phra ba la sogs pa yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang nye bar len par gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems kyang ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If subtle form, and so on, are not the object of apprehension because they are not the object of apprehension of form, and so on, and they are not the other mind because they are not the appropriated aggregates,

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi de gnyi ga gzung bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi de gnyi ga gzung bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: then the yogis would not apprehend both.

original: 'gyur ba yin pa de'i phyir gzud ba'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin pa de'i phyir gzud ba'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But they do apprehend them. Therefore, the object of apprehension is mistaken.

original: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that fault does not exist.üîΩBecause it is said:

analyzed: rtog pa bsam mi khyab /

analyzed: phra ba la sogs pa'i mthong ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //

original: de dag gi dngos po rnams la gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa'i khyad par nyid yin pa de ltar na de la brten nas gzung ba'am 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po rnams la gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa'i khyad par nyid yin pa de ltar na de la brten nas gzung ba'am 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics of apprehended objects do not exist for them.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / phra rab la sogs ngo bo yis //üîΩgzung ba ste gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang / phra rab la sogs ngo bo yis // gzung ba ste gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe /

analyzed: gzung med nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: gzugs sogs blo la de dag thams cad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs blo la de dag thams cad yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de bas na 'di'i snang ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i snang ba'i gnas skabs na /

analyzed: gzung ba nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu sngar med gang de 'dra de phyis skyes pa yang ci zhig yin /

analyzed: gang gis na gzung ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /

original: ma yin @266b ba nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ma yin @266b ba nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //

original: de'i phyir sems gzhan gyis rang blo 'dzin yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems gzhan gyis rang blo 'dzin yod na /

analyzed: rang gi blo la 'dzin pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //

original: de ltar na yang 'di ltar khas blangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'di ltar khas blangs nas /

analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nye bar ma gtogs pa don gzhan dang gzugs la sogs pa la brten min te /

analyzed: mthong ba med pa de ltar na yul gzhan la 'pho ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni ma yin te /

analyzed: nye bar len pa'i nus pa gzhan yin zhing gzhan pa nyid kyi nus pa yang gzhan yin pa de ltar na /

original: ji ltar na nye bar len pa'i nus pa gcig gis nye bar sbyor bar byed na gzung ba'i nus pa'i nye bar sbyor ba med par gzung ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /üîΩnus pa gcig dang ldan pa'am //
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar len pa'i nus pa gcig gis nye bar sbyor bar byed na gzung ba'i nus pa'i nye bar sbyor ba med par gzung ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na / nus pa gcig dang ldan pa'am //
translated: In that case, if one power of the appropriated connects, how could there be a connection of the power of the apprehended without the connection of the appropriated?üîΩIt is not the case that one who possesses one power

analyzed: nus pa du ma dad ldan pa las 'ga' zhig 'bras bu gcig dang du ma med pa ma yin no //

original: nus ba du ma gcig med pa na yang nus pa du ma med na /

analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te gcig las du ma mi 'gyur //

analyzed: dngos po gcig las 'bras bu du ma 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /

original: du ma ni rgyu du ma las yin no zhes rang gi sde pa'i yin no //
analyzed: du ma ni rgyu du ma las yin no zhes rang gi sde pa'i yin no //

original: de de ltar ni yin na /
analyzed: de de ltar ni yin na /

original: gcig las gcig ni cir mi rung //
analyzed: gcig las gcig ni cir mi rung //

original: 'on kyang / tshogs pa dag las thams cad 'byung //
analyzed: 'on kyang / tshogs pa dag las thams cad 'byung //

original: tshogs pa gcig las tshogs pa cig shos 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig las tshogs pa cig shos 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gal te 'di ltar gcig du ma'i skyed par byed pa yin no zhes skabs gzhan du brjod pa gang yin pa de dang ji ltar na 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de ni 'gal ba ma yin te dgongs pa gzhan gyis de skad du bstan pa'i phyir ro // de ltar @267a * //
translated: That is not contradictory, because it is taught in that way with another intention.

analyzed: na gcig du ma byed pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa du mar gyur pa nyid kyi skyed par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bshad do //

analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa dag ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la nye bar gnas pa dag ni /

analyzed: de 'dra bar gyur pa'i dngos po gcig 'gyur ba yang /

analyzed: dper na gzugs gcig nye bar len pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas /
translated: just as a single form is the appropriator of the aggregates.

analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la rigs mthun pa'i gzugs skyed par byed pa de la ro la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa gcig yin no //

analyzed: tshogs pa gcig po 'di la gnas pa dmigs pa'i ngo bor nye bar sbyor bar rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa de la yang rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin zhing mig la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhes

original: bya ba la sogs pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa gzhan yin no //

original: de de la gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de de la gnas pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de de ltar na tshogs pa gnyis po dag ni du ma'i rgyu'i gzugs du ma nyid phyed par brjod kyi /

analyzed: de nyid gcig skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid skyed par byed pa gzung ba nyid yin pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa'i sgo nas skyed par 'gyur ba gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe /

analyzed: de ltar na rtag tu shes pa gzhan dang gzhan skyed pas 'di yul gzhan la 'pho ba ma yin no zhe na /

original: de ni dran pa las yang thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dran pa las yang thal ba ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung ba nyid du nges pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Since it is the characteristic of the object of the prior consciousness that generates it, it is ascertained as the object.

analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa shes pa phyi ma 'jug pas yul gzhan du 'pho bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the subsequent consciousness arises through the power of the object, it does not move to other objects.

original: de ltar dran pa'i nye bar len par gyur pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa'i nye bar len par gyur pa'i shes pa'am /

analyzed: gzhan gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin na /

analyzed: gang gis na gzung ba nyid @267b du nges pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po'i stobs la brten nas skyes pa las 'pho ba ma yin no //

analyzed: mngon sum la ni yul gyi gzung ba'i mtshan nyid 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin te /

analyzed: de ni yul gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yul gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rang gi nus pa la nges pa yin no //

analyzed: dran pa ni bag chags sad ba tsam las skyes pa de ltar na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Memory is produced merely from the awakening of the latent impressions. Thus there is no fault.

analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /

analyzed: rnam shes snga ma 'dzin 'gyur na //

analyzed: gzhan ni shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi blo phyi ma ste /

analyzed: don gang la 'pho bar 'dod pa'i don de dang rnam par shes pa snga ma de ma thag tu 'das pa cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ba des na yul gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhe na / sems gcig la rim bzhin mthong ba can te /
translated: Why?üîΩBecause the two statements that the same consciousness sees sequentially

analyzed: rim bzhin du 'gyur pa'i brjod pa gnyis mthong ba de nyid / rtag tu go rims can mi 'gyur //

original: cig car 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car 'gyur ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: snga phyir snang ba nyid phyir ro //

analyzed: yi ge ai la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i dang tshul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de la yi ge ai dang shes pa snga ma yod pa'i yi ge aa snang ba de ltar na /

analyzed: yi ge 'dzin pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúapart from the apprehension of the letter‚Äù means ‚Äúapart from the apprehension of the letter i.‚Äù

original: sogs pa smos pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa las /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa las /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the cognition that apprehends the eye consciousness.üîΩIn some cases, the cognition that appears as form and the cognition that appears as sound are different.

analyzed: la lar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang la lar gzhan yin no zhes yul la 'jug pa nges pa med pa can gyis shes pa dag gzung ngo //

analyzed: des na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la gzugs kyi snang ba dang / sgra'i snang ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in the cognition that has the mode of apprehension of the apprehension of the eye consciousness, the appearance of form and the appearance of sound

analyzed: snang ba 'di gnyis cig car snang bar 'gyur na /

analyzed: snang bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //

original: gcig kyang gnyis gnyis snang ba ni //
analyzed: gcig kyang gnyis gnyis snang ba ni //

translated: When one remembers the time of an experience of consciousness, it is seen that it is remembered by that consciousness. It is not reasonable to remember what was not experienced.

original: de la shes pa gang las 'pho ba de na rang rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la shes pa gang las 'pho ba de na rang rig par 'gyur ro //
